10.10: He shall be humbled and overthrown, and in his bones there shall be sickness and pain.
10.11: He says in his heart, God has forgotten; he has turned away his face; he will never see it.
10.12: Arise, O LORD; O my God, lift up thine hand; forget not the afflicted.
10.13: Why does the wicked provoke God? He says in his heart, God does not seek vengeance.
10.14: Thou hast seen it; for there is mischief and wrath, for thou beholdest that he hath surrendered himself unto thy hands; and the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
10.15: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man; seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
10.16: The LORD is King for ever and ever; the Gentiles are perished out of his land.
10.17: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the poor; thine ear hath heard the preparation of their heart;
10.18: Execute justice to the fatherless and to the afflicted, so that man may not be destroyed from the face of the earth.

11.1: IN the LORD put I my trust; how say you to me, Flee as a bird to the mountains?
11.2: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow; they make ready their arrow upon the string to shoot in the dark at the upright in heart.
11.3: For if they have destroyed the foundations which the LORD has prepared, what can the righteous do?
11.4: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD'S throne is in heaven; his eyes behold, his eyelids examine, the children of men.
11.5: The LORD tries the righteous and the wicked; but his soul hates him that loves violence.
11.6: Snares have come down upon the wicked like rain; fire and brimstone and a destructive tempest shall be the portion of their cup.
11.7: For the LORD is righteous, and he loves righteousness; his countenance beholds the upright.

12.1: SAVE, O LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for faith hath disappeared from the earth.
12.2: Men speak vanity, every one with his neighbour; with flattering lips, and with a double heart do they speak.
12.3: The LORD shall destroy all flattering lips and tongues that speak proud things.
12.4: For they have said, With our tongue will we prevail: our lips are our own; who is lord over us?
12.5: Because of the oppression of the poor and the groans of the needy, now will I arise, says the LORD; and I will bring salvation openly.
12.6: The words of the LORD are pure words; as silver tried in a furnace on earth, they are purified seven times.
12.7: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD; thou shalt preserve me and save me from this generation for ever.
12.8: For the wicked walk everywhere with contemptible pride like the children of Edom.

13.1: HOW long, O LORD, wilt thou forsake me? For ever? How long wilt thou turn away thy face from me?
13.2: How long shall I keep sorrow in my soul and misery in my heart daily? How long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
13.3: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God; lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep in death,
13.4: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him, and those that trouble me rejoice when I am shaken.
13.5: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
13.6: I will sing unto the LORD, because he has saved me.

14.1: THE fool has said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have been defiled by their own devices; there is none that does good.
14.2: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men to see if there were any that did understand and seek God.
14.3: They are all gone astray and have been rejected all together; there is none that does good; no, not one.
14.4: They recognized not the workers of iniquity, who devour my people as one eats bread; and they called not upon the LORD.
14.5: There were they in great fear; for God is in the generation of the righteous.
14.6: They have reproached the counsel of the poor, because he trusts on the LORD.
14.7: Who shall give out of Zion the salvation to Israel? When the LORD brings back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice and Israel shall be glad.

15.1: LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? who shall inhabit thy holy mountain?
15.2: He that walks uprightly and works righteousness and speaks the truth in his heart.
15.3: He that deceives not with his tongue, nor does evil to his neighbor, nor accepts a bribe from his neighbor;
15.4: In whose eyes a detestable person is despised; but he honors them that worship the LORD; he that swears to his neighbor and lies not;
15.5: He that lends not out his money with interest, nor takes a bribe against the innocent. He that does these things is upright and shall never be moved.

16.1: PRESERVE me, O God; for in thee do I put my trust.
16.2: I have said unto the LORD, Thou art my LORD, and my goodness cometh from thee;
16.3: I said it also to the saints that are on the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.
16.4: The sorrows of the wicked shall be multiplied in rapid succession that I may not pour out their libations of blood; nor will I mention their names with my lips.
16.5: The LORD is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup; thou shalt restore my inheritance.
16.6: My portion of the land fell to me in goodly places; yea, I have been pleased with my heritage.
16.7: I will bless the LORD, for he has given me counsel; my intuition also guides me during the night.
16.8: I have set the LORD always before me; because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
16.9: Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices; my flesh also shall rest in hope.
16.10: For thou hast left not my soul in Sheol; neither hast thou suffered thy Holy One to see corruption.
16.11: Thou wilt show me the path of life, and I shall be filled with the joy of thy countenance, with the pleasure of victory of thy right hand.

17.1: HEAR, O Holy LORD, and consider my supplication; give ear unto my prayer that proceedeth not out of deceitful lips.
17.2: Let my judgment come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are just.
17.3: Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and thou hast not found iniquity in me; nothing hath come out of my mouth which is according to the deceitful works of men.
17.4: Through the conversation of my lips thou hast kept me from evil ways.
17.5: Thou hast strengthened my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
17.6: I have called upon thee, for thou hast heard me. O God, incline thine ear unto me and hear my words.
17.7: Make thy Holy One a wonder and a Saviour to those who trust; but let him prevail against those that rise up against thy right hand.
17.8: Keep me as the apple of the eye; protect me under the shadow of thy wings,
17.9: From the sinners who plunder me, from the enemies of my soul who surround me.
17.10: Silence their mouth, for they have spoken vanity.
17.11: They have praised me, and now have surrounded me; they have determined to bury me in the ground.
17.12: They are like a lion that is eager to prey, and like a young lion lurking in secret places.
17.13: Arise, O LORD, humble them; cast them down; deliver my soul from the wicked and from the sword,
17.14: From the dead that die by thy hand, O LORD; and from the dead of the grave, divide their possessions among the living; fill their belly with thy treasure, so that their children are satisfied and have a portion remaining for their own children.
17.15: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness; I shall be satisfied when thy worship is revived.

18.1: I WILL love thee, O LORD, my strength and my trust;
18.2: My refuge and my deliverer is the mighty God in whom I trust; he is my helper and the horn of my salvation and my glorious refuge.
18.3: I will call upon the LORD; so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
18.4: For the pains of death surrounded me, and the rush of ungodly men have confused me.
18.5: The travail of Sheol has taken hold of me: the snares of death preceded me.
18.6: In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried to my God; he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
18.7: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the mountains quaked and were shaken because he was angry.
18.8: There went up a smoke out of his wrath, and fire flamed from his face, and coals were kindled by it.
18.9: He bowed the heavens and came down; and thick darkness was under his feet.
18.10: And he rode upon cherubim and flew; yea, he soared upon the wings of the wind.
18.11: He made darkness his covert; his pavilion round about him was darkness of waters and thick clouds of the skies.
18.12: Out of the brightness of his shadow his clouds rained hailstones and coals of fire.
18.13: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice: hailstones and coals of fire.
18.14: Yea, he sent out his arrows and scattered them; and he multiplied his lightnings and confused them.
18.15: Then the brooks appeared, and the foundations of the world were laid open at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thine anger.
18.16: He sent from on high and quieted me; he received me out of great waters.
18.17: He delivered me from my strong enemies and from them which hated me; for they were too strong for me.
18.18: They confronted me in the day of my extremity, but the LORD was my deliverer.
18.19: He brought me forth into comfort; he delivered me because he delighted in me.
18.20: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands has he recompensed me.
18.21: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not revolted against my God.
18.22: For all his judgments were before me, and his laws I did not put away from me.
18.23: I was also blameless before him, and I carefully kept myself from my sins.
18.24: Therefore has the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyes.
18.25: With the pure thou shalt be pure; with an upright man thou shalt be upright.
18.26: With the clean thou shalt be clean; and from the crooked thou shalt turn aside.
18.27: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt humble the proud.
18.28: For thou wilt light my lamp; the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.
18.29: For through thee I have pursued a band of robbers; and through my God have I leaped over a fence.
18.30: As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is pure: he is a help to all those that trust in him.
18.31: For there is no God save the LORD; and there is no one who is mighty like our God.
18.32: It is God that girds me with strength and makes my way perfect.
18.33: He makes my feet like hart's feet and sets me upon high places.
18.34: He trains my hands to war; and he strengthens my arms like a bow of brass.
18.35: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation; and thy right hand hath held me up; and thy discipline hath made me great.
18.36: Thou hast steadied my legs under me, that my ankles may not be weakened.
18.37: I will pursue my enemies and overtake them; and I will not turn again till they are consumed.
18.38: I will smite them so that they shall not be able to stand; they shall fall under my feet.
18.39: For thou hast girded me with strength to the battle; thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
18.40: Thou hast also defeated my enemies before me, that I might silence them that hate me.
18.41: They shall cry, but there will be none to save them; they shall beg the LORD, but he will not answer them.
18.42: Then I will beat them small as the dust before the wind; I will tread over them as the mire of the streets.
18.43: Thou wilt deliver me from the judgments of the people; and thou wilt make me the leader of the Gentiles; a people whom I have not known shall serve me.
18.44: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me; strangers shall submit themselves to me.
18.45: Strangers shall halt and shall be hindered from walking in their paths.
18.46: The LORD lives; blessed be the one who gives me strength; let my God and my Saviour be exalted.
18.47: It is God that avenges me and subdues the people under me.
18.48: He delivered me from my enemies; yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me; thou hast delivered me from lawless man.
18.49: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the Gentiles, and sing praises unto thy name.
18.50: Great deliverance gives he to his king; and shows mercy to his anointed, to David and to his descendants for evermore.

19.1: THE heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament shows his handiwork.
19.2: Day after day utters speech, and night after night shows knowledge.
19.3: There is no speech nor language where their voice is not heard.
19.4: Their good news has gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. He has set his tabernacle in the sun among them.
19.5: And he is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoices as a strong man to run a race.
19.6: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends thereof; and there is nothing hid from the mist of his breath.
19.7: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul; the testimony of the LORD is trustworthy, making wise the young men.
19.8: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.
19.9: The reverence of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever; the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
19.10: They are more to be coveted than gold; yea, than precious stones; sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
19.11: Moreover by them is thy servant warned; and if he keep them he shall be greatly rewarded.
19.12: Who can understand stumblings? Cleanse thou me from secret faults.
19.13: Spare thy servant also from presumptuous sins, lest the evil ones have dominion over me; then shall I be cleansed from my sins.
19.14: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my helper and my Saviour.

20.1: MAY the LORD answer you in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend you;
20.2: Send you help from his sanctuary, and strengthen you out of Zion.
20.3: Let the LORD remember all your offerings, and make acceptable your burnt sacrifices.
20.4: May the LORD grant you according to your own heart, and fulfil all your counsel.
20.5: We will be glorified in your salvation, and in the name of our God we will be exalted; the LORD fulfil all your petitions.
20.6: Henceforth it is known that the LORD has saved his anointed; and has heard him from his holy heaven and saved with the strength of his right hand.
20.7: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses; but we will prevail through the name of the LORD our God.
20.8: They are bowed down and fallen; but we are risen and stand ready.
20.9: O LORD, save us, and let our King answer us in the day when we call upon him.

21.1: THE king shall rejoice in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
21.2: Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withheld the request of his lips.
21.3: For thou hast blessed him beforehand with the blessings of goodness; thou hast set a precious crown on his head.
21.4: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.
21.5: His glory is great in thy salvation; honor and majesty hast thou bestowed upon him.
21.6: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever; thou hast made him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.
21.7: For the king trusts in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
21.8: Your hand shall overcome all your enemies; your right hand shall overcome those that hate you.
21.9: You shall make them as a fiery oven in the time of your wrath; the LORD shall consume them in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
21.10: Their fruit shall you destroy from the earth, and their offspring from among the children of men.
21.11: For they have planned evil against you; they conceived a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.
21.12: For you shall place a scar on them; and you shall make ready your array against their faces.
21.13: Be thou exalted, O LORD, in thine own strength; so will we sing and praise thy power.

22.1: MY God, my God, why hast thou let me to live? and yet thou hast delayed my salvation from me, because of the words of my folly.
22.2: O my God, I call thee in the daytime but thou answerest me not; and in the night season thou abidest not with me.
22.3: For thou art holy, and Israel dwells under thy glory.
22.4: Our fathers trusted in thee; they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
22.5: They cried unto thee and were delivered; they trusted in thee and were not confounded.
22.6: But I am a worm, and not a man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
22.7: All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn; they shoot out with their lips, they shake their heads, saying,
22.8: He trusted in the LORD; let the LORD deliver him; let him save him, if he be delighted in him.
22.9: For thou art my trust since I came out of the womb, and my hope since I was upon my mother's breasts.
22.10: I was put under thy care from the womb; thou art my God from my mother's belly.
22.11: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
22.12: Many bulls have surrounded me: strong bulls of Bashan have besieged me.
22.13: Their mouths snarl against me, as a ravening and roaring lion.
22.14: I am poured out like water and all my bones are out of joint; my heart is melted like wax, and my bowels are wasted in the midst of me.
22.15: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaves to my jaws; and thou hast thrown me into the dust of death.
22.16: For the vicious have surrounded me; the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me; they have pierced my hands and my feet.
22.17: My bones ached with pain; they looked and stared upon me.
22.18: They parted my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
22.19: But, O LORD, be not thou far from me; O God, O God, abide to help me.
22.20: Deliver my soul from the sword, my only one from the hand of the vicious.
22.21: Save me from the lion's mouth; save my meekness from the haughty,
22.22: That I may declare thy name to my brethren; in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
22.23: You that revere the LORD, praise him; all you the offspring of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all you descendants of Israel.
22.24: For he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the poor; neither has he turned away his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard him.
22.25: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation; I will fulfil my vows before them that worship him.
22.26: The poor shall eat and be satisfied; they shall praise the LORD that seek him; their hearts shall live for ever.
22.27: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn to the LORD; and all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall worship before thee.
22.28: For the kingdom is the LORD'S; he is the governor over the Gentiles.
22.29: All they that are hungry upon earth shall eat and worship before the LORD; all they that are buried shall kneel before him; my soul is alive to him.
22.30: An offspring shall serve him; the generations thereof shall proclaim the LORD.
22.31: They shall come and declare his righteousness to a people that shall be born, and tell that which the LORD has done.

23.1: THE LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
23.2: He makes me to rest in green pastures; he leads me beside still waters.
23.3: He restores my soul. He leads me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.
23.4: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
23.5: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies; thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
23.6: Surely thy goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life; and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.

24.1: THE earth is the LORD'S and the fulness thereof; the world and they that dwell therein.
24.2: For he has set the foundation thereof in the sea, and has furnished it with rivers.
24.3: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the LORD? or who shall stand in his holy place?
24.4: He who has clean hands and a pure heart; who has not sworn by his soul falsely, nor taken an oath deceitfully.
24.5: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from God our Saviour.
24.6: This is the generation of them that seek thy face, that proclaim thy countenance, O thou God of Jacob.
24.7: Lift up your heads, O you gates; and be lifted up, O everlasting doors, that the King of glory may come in.
24.8: Who is this King of glory? The LORD, strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.
24.9: Lift up your heads, O you gates; and be lifted up, O everlasting doors, that the King of glory may come in.
24.10: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory forever.

25.1: UNTO thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.
25.2: O my God, I trust in thee; let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.
25.3: Yea, let none that trust in thee be ashamed; let the wicked be ashamed with their vanity.
25.4: Show me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.
25.5: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me; for thou art my God and my Saviour; on thee do I wait all the day.
25.6: Remember, O LORD, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they are from the beginning of the world.
25.7: Remember not the foolishness of my youth, but according to thine abundant mercy remember thou me because of thy goodness' sake, O God.
25.8: Good and upright is the LORD; therefore will he direct sinners in the way.
25.9: He will guide the meek in judgment, and he will teach the poor his way.
25.10: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
25.11: For thy name's sake, O LORD, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.
25.12: What man is he that fears the LORD? Him shall he teach in the way that he has chosen.
25.13: His soul shall abide with grace, and his offspring shall inherit the earth.
25.14: The LORD is mindful of them that worship him, and he will show them his covenant.
25.15: My eyes are ever toward the LORD; for he will release my feet out of the net.
25.16: Turn thou unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am the only son and destitute.
25.17: The troubles of my heart are multiplied; O bring thou me out of my distresses.
25.18: Look upon my affliction and my labor; and forgive all my sins.
25.19: Consider my enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with an unjust hatred.
25.20: O keep my soul, and deliver me, because I have trusted in thee.
25.21: The innocent and the upright have followed me because I have trusted in thee.
25.22: God has saved Israel from all of his oppressors.

26.1: JUDGE me, O LORD; for I have walked in my integrity; I have trusted also in the LORD; therefore I shall not waver.
26.2: Prove me, O LORD, and try me; examine my mind and my heart.
26.3: For thy lovingkindness is before my eyes, and I have walked in thy faith.
26.4: I have not sat with evil persons; neither have I associated with detestable persons.
26.5: I have hated the congregation of evildoers; and have not sat with the wicked.
26.6: I have washed my hands clean, and I have gone around thy altar, O LORD,
26.7: That I may hear the voice of thy praise and tell of all thy wondrous works.
26.8: LORD, I have loved the ritual of thy house and the place where thy glory dwelleth.
26.9: Destroy me not with sinners nor my life with bloody men,
26.10: In whose hands is mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.
26.11: But as for me, I will walk in my integrity; save me and be merciful unto me.
26.12: My foot has stood in the straight way; in the congregation will I bless the LORD.

27.1: THE LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
27.2: When evildoers came upon me to devour me, even my enemies and those who hate me, they together stumbled and fell.
27.3: Though a host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
27.4: One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the delight of the LORD, and to be in charge of his temple.
27.5: For in the day of trouble he shall hide me in his shelter; in the shadow of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
27.6: And now shall my head he lifted up above my enemies round about me; therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises to the LORD.
27.7: Hear, O LORD, my voice when I call upon thee; have mercy also upon me and answer me.
27.8: My heart said unto thee, Let my face seek thy face.
27.9: Turn not away thy face from me, O LORD; trouble not thy servant in anger; thou hast been my help, O LORD; east me not out, neither leave me, O my God and my Saviour.
27.10: Although my father and my mother have deserted me, the LORD has taken me up.
27.11: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in thy right paths.
27.12: Deliver me not over into the hands of my enemies; for false witnesses are risen up against me and have spoken cruelly.
27.13: But I have believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
27.14: Trust in the LORD, and be of good courage; yea, trust in the LORD.

28.1: UNTO thee have I cried, O my God; be not silent to me, lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.
28.2: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy temple.
28.3: Count me not with the wicked and with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace with their neighbours, but mischief is in their hearts.
28.4: Reward them according to their deeds and according to their evil doings.
28.5: Because they have not understood the works of the LORD nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them and not build them up.
28.6: Blessed be the LORD, because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
28.7: The LORD is my helper and my protector; my heart trusted in him, and I am happy; I will praise him with glorious song.
28.8: The LORD is the strength of his people, and he is the protector of the salvation of his anointed.
28.9: Save thy people, O LORD, and bless thine inheritance; shepherd them also, and take care of them for ever,

29.1: BRING unto the LORD the offspring of rams; bring unto the LORD glory and honour.
29.2: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the court of his holy temple.
29.3: The voice of the LORD is upon the waters; the God of glory thunders; the LORD is upon many waters.
29.4: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
29.5: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; yea, the LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6: He makes them also to skip like calves, Lebanon and Sirion like a young ox.
29.7: The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire.
29.8: The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
29.9: The voice of the LORD makes the hinds to tremble, and uproots the forests; and in his temple every one speaks of his glory.
29.10: The LORD controls the flood; yea, the LORD sits King for ever.
29.11: The LORD will give strength to his people; the LORD will bless his people with peace.

30.1: I WILL extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
30.2: O LORD, my God, I have sought thee, and thou hast healed me.
30.3: Thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol; thou hast saved me that I should not join those who go down to the pit.
30.4: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
30.5: For there is rebuke in his anger and life in his good will; weeping may last for a night, but joy comes in the morning.
30.6: In my security I said, I shall never be moved.
30.7: O God, by thy favor thou hast increased my glory; thou didst turn away thy face, and I was troubled.
30.8: I cried to thee, O LORD, and unto the LORD I made supplication.
30.9: What profit is there in shedding my blood, when I go down to corruption? The dust will not praise thee and it will not declare thy truth.
30.10: Hear, O God, and have mercy upon me; O LORD, be thou my helper.
30.11: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into joy; thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
30.12: Therefore, I will sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD, my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

31.1: IN thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed; deliver me in thy righteousness.
31.2: Incline thine ear to me and answer me speedily; be thou unto me the God, the helper, and the house of refuge; and save me,
31.3: For thou art my strength and my refuge; therefore for thy name's sake comfort me and guide me.
31.4: Pull me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me; for thou art my protector.
31.5: Into thy hand I commit my spirit; thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
31.6: I have hated them that observe false worship; but I trust in thee, O LORD.
31.7: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy; for thou hast seen my humility; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
31.8: And thou hast not surrendered me into the hand of my enemies; thou hast established my feet in tranquility.
31.9: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in distress; mine eye is troubled with wrath, yea, my soul and my body.
31.10: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing; my strength is weakened because of poverty, and my bones are shaken because of my enemies.
31.11: I have become a reproach to my neighbors and a dread to my acquaintances: they that saw me on the street fled from me.
31.12: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind; I am like something given up for lost.
31.13: For I have heard of the complicity of many persons; while they connived together against me, they schemed to take away my life.
31.14: But I trusted in thee, O LORD; I said, Thou art my God, O LORD.
31.15: The times are in thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies and from them that persecute me.
31.16: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; save me through thy mercies.
31.17: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee; let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
31.18: Let the lips of the wicked be silent; for they speak falsely and disdainfully against the righteous.
31.19: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that worship thee, which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
31.20: Hide them in the citadel of thy presence from the tumult of men; with thy shadow guard them from contention.
31.21: Blessed be the LORD, for he has elected for himself the chosen ones in a strong city?
31.22: I said in my haste, I am lost from before thine eyes; nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
31.23: O love the LORD, all you his righteous ones; for the LORD preserves the faithful, and rewards the wicked according to their works.
31.24: Be of good courage and he shall strengthen your heart, all you that trust in the LORD.

32.1: BLESSED is he whose transgression is forgiven and whose sin is blotted out.
32.2: Blessed is the man to whom the LORD has not reckoned his iniquity, and in whose heart there is no guile.
32.3: Because I suffered in silence all the day long, my bones waxed old during my deep slumber.
32.4: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me; intense pain developed in my heart great enough to kill me.
32.5: I have acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid from thee. I said, I will confess my faults to the LORD; and thou forgavest all of my sins.
32.6: For this let every one that is chosen pray unto thee at an appointed time; surely even the floods of great waters shall not come near him.
32.7: Thou art my refuge; thou shalt protect me from mine enemies; thou wilt compass me about with glory and salvation.
32.8: I have made you to understand and have led you on the way which you shall take; I will follow you with my eyes.
32.9: Be not as the horse or as the mule, which have no understanding, which must be subdued with bit and bridle from their youth; no one goes near them.
32.10: The wicked has many sorrows; but he that trusts in the LORD, mercy shall surround him.
32.11: Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you righteous; and praise him, all you that are upright in heart.

33.1: REJOICE in the LORD, O you righteous; for praise is comely for the upright.
33.2: Praise the LORD with harp and guitar; sing praises to him with a harp of ten strings.
33.3: Sing to him a new song; play skilfully with a beautiful rhythm.
33.4: For the word of the LORD is right; and all his works are done in truth.
33.5: He loves righteousness and judgment; the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.
33.6: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
33.7: The waters of the sea gathers he together as in a heap of waterskins; he lays up the depths in storehouses.
33.8: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
33.9: For he spoke, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.
33.10: The LORD brings the counsel of the Gentiles to nought; the LORD makes the devices of the people of no effect.
33.11: The counsel of the LORD stands for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
33.12: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD; and the people whom he has chosen for his own inheritance.
33.13: The LORD looks from heaven; he beholds all the sons of men.
33.14: From his throne he looks upon all the inhabitants of the earth.
33.15: He fashions their hearts alike; he considers all their works.
33.16: The king is not saved by the multitude of a host; neither a mighty man delivers by much strength.
33.17: A horse is a false thing for salvation; neither shall he deliver his rider by his great strength.
33.18: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon the righteous, upon them that hope in his mercy
33.19: To deliver their soul from death and to keep them alive in famine.
33.20: Our soul waits for the LORD; he is our help and our shield.
33.21: For our hearts shall rejoice in him because we have trusted in his holy name.
33.22: Let thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.

34.1: I WILL bless the LORD at all times; his praises shall continually be in my mouth.
34.2: My soul shall make its boast in the LORD; let the humble hear and be glad.
34.3: O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt his name together.
34.4: I sought the LORD, and he heard and delivered me from all my troubles.
34.5: Look towards him and trust in him, and you shall not be disappointed.
34.6: This poor man called on him, and he heard him and saved him from all his troubles.
34.7: The host of angels of the LORD encamps round about them that worship him, and delivers them.
34.8: O taste and see that the LORD is good; blessed is the man that trusts in him.
34.9: The rich have become poor and suffer hunger;
34.10: They that seek the LORD shall not lack any good thing.
34.11: Come, you children, listen to me, and I will teach you reverence for the LORD.
34.12: Where is the man who desires not life and many days that he may see the good time to come?
34.13: Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking guile.
34.14: Depart from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.
34.15: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, and his ears are open to hear them.
34.16: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
34.17: The righteous cried, and the LORD hears, and delivers them out of all their troubles.
34.18: The LORD is near to them that are brokenhearted, and he saves those who are humble in spirit.
34.19: Many are the afflictions of the righteous; but the LORD delivers him out of them all.
34.20: He keeps all his bones, not one of them is broken.
34.21: Evil shall slay the wicked, and they that hate the righteous shall be destroyed.
34.22: The LORD redeems the soul of his servants, and none of them that trust in him shall be condemned.

35.1: PLEAD my cause, O LORD, with them that strive with me; fight against them that fight against me.
35.2: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for my help.
35.3: Draw out the sword and flash it against them that persecute me; say unto my soul. I am your Saviour.
35.4: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul; let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise evil against me.
35.5: Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the angel of the LORD chase them.
35.6: Let their way be dark and slippery, and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.
35.7: For they have dug pits for me and have spread a snare for my soul.
35.8: Let evil come upon them unawares; and let the net that they have hidden trap them; into that very pit which they have dug let them fall.
35.9: My soul shall be joyful in God; it shall rejoice in his salvation.
35.10: All my bones shall say, LORD, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the poor from his enemies, yea, the poor and the needy from him that seizes his property by force?
35.11: False witnesses rose up; they charged me with things that I knew not.
35.12: They rewarded me evil for good, and they destroyed my reputation among men.
35.13: But as for me, when they were sick, I wore sackcloth; I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer returned into my own bosom.
35.14: I behaved myself as though they had been my friends and brothers; I bowed down heavily, as one miserable in deep mourning.
35.15: During my misery they gathered together and rejoiced; yea, they gathered together against me for a long time, and I knew it not;
35.16: With their boasting and mocking, they gnashed at me with their teeth.
35.17: My LORD, I have suffered enough; rescue my soul from their riot, my only one from the lions.
35.18: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise thee among many people.
35.19: Let mine enemies not rejoice over me, nor the mockers who hate me for no reason; they wink with their eyes but they do not salute.
35.20: Against the meek of the earth, they devise mischievous things.
35.21: Yea, they opened their mouths wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye has seen it.
35.22: This thou hast seen, O God; keep not silence; O my LORD, be not far from the.
35.23: stir up thyself and awake to my judgment, see my suffering, my God and my LORD.
35.24: judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
35.25: Let them not say in their hearts, We have rid ourselves of him and we have buried him.
35.26: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion who wish me evil; let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
35.27: Let them who are pleased with my victory shout for joy and be glad; yea, let them say continually, The LORD be magnified who has pleasure in the peace of his servant,
35.28: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.

36.1: THE unjust conceives wickedness within his heart, for there is no fear of God before his eyes.
36.2: He is unwilling to see his sins forgiven, or to hate them.
36.3: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit; he is unwilling to do good.
36.4: He devises mischief upon his bed; he walks in a way that is not good that he may do evil.
36.5: O LORD, thy mercy is in heaven; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the universe.
36.6: Thy righteouness is like the mountain of God; thy judgments are like a great deep; O LORD, thou preservest man and beast.
36.7: How abundant is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men take refuge under the shadow of thy wings.
36.8: They shall flourish with the richness of thy house; and thou shalt give them to drink of the pleasant water of thy spring.
36.9: For with thee is the fountain of life; in thy light shall we see light.
36.10: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee, and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
36.11: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
36.12: For there the workers of iniquity will fall; they will be cast down, and will not be able to rise.

37.1: FRET not because of evildoers, neither be envious of the workers of iniquity,
37.2: For they shall soon wither like grass, and fade away as the green herbs.
37.3: Trust in God, and do good; dwell in the land, and seek after faithfulness.
37.4: Trust in the LORD; and he shall give you the desires of your heart.
37.5: Commit your way to the LORD; trust also in him, and he shall bring it to pass.
37.6: He shall bring forth your righteousness as the light, and your judgment as the noonday.
37.7: Seek the LORD, and pray before him; envy not the man who does evil, and prospers in his way.
37.8: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; fret not yourself in any wise to do evil.
37.9: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those who trust in the LORD shall inherit the earth.
37.10: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall be no more: yea, you shall look for his place, and you shall not find it.
37.11: But the meek shall inherit the earth, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
37.12: The wicked plots against the just, and gnashes at him with his teeth.
37.13: The LORD shall laugh at him; for he sees that his day is coming.
37.14: The wicked have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow, to slay the poor and needy, and those who are upright in their way.
37.15: Their swords shall enter into their own hearts, and their bows shall be broken.
37.16: A little that a righteous man has is better than the great riches of the wicked.
37.17: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken; but the LORD upholds the righteous.
37.18: The LORD knows the days of the upright; and their inheritance shall be for ever.
37.19: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time; and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
37.20: For the wicked shall perish, and the rich who are enemies of the LORD shall be consumed; they shall vanish like smoke.
37.21: The wicked borrows, and pays not again; but the righteous shows mercy, and gives.
37.22: For the blessed of the LORD shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be wiped out.
37.23: The steps of a good man are established by the LORD; he sets his course.
37.24: Though he fall, he shall not be hurt; for the LORD upholds him with his hand.
37.25: I have been young, and now am old; yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his descendants begging bread.
37.26: But he is ever merciful and lends; and his offspring is blessed.
37.27: Depart from evil, and do good; and rest for evermore.
37.28: For the LORD loves justice, and he forsakes not his righteous ones; he keeps them for ever; but the seed of the wicked, he destroys.
37.29: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
37.30: The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom, and his tongue talks of justice.
37.31: The law of God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.
37.32: The wicked lies in wait for the righteous, and seeks to slay him.
37.33: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
37.34: Trust in the LORD and keep his way, and he shall exalt you to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
37.35: For I have seen the wicked boasting and spreading himself like stout forest trees;
37.36: Yet when I passed by, lo, he was not; yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.
37.37: Uphold the perfect and select the upright; for there is a good end for peaceful men.
37.38: But sinners shall be destroyed together; yea, the end of the wicked shall be destruction.
37.39: But the Saviour of the righteous is the LORD; he will help them in time of trouble.
37.40: And the LORD shall help them and deliver them; he shall deliver them from the wicked and save them, because they trust in him.

38.1: O LORD, rebuke me not in thy wrath; neither chasten me in the heat of thine anger.
38.2: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand rests heavily upon me.
38.3: There is no peace in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sins.
38.4: For mine iniquities are gone over my head; as a great burden they are too heavy for me.
38.5: My wounds are loathsome and corrupt because of my foolishness.
38.6: I am greatly troubled; all the day long I walk sadly.
38.7: My loins are filled with trembling, and there is no peace in my body.
38.8: I am feeble and miserable; I have groaned because of the despair of my heart.
38.9: O LORD, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hidden from thee.
38.10: My heart is broken, my strength hath failed me; as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
38.11: My neighbors and my friends stood aside from my grief; and my kinsmen stood off.
38.12: They also that seek after my life and wish me evil lay hold on me and speak mischievous things and imagine deceits all the day long.
38.13: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that opens not his mouth.
38.14: Thus I was as a man that hears not, and in whose mouth is no reproof.
38.15: For in thee, O LORD, do I hope; thou wilt answer me, O LORD my God.
38.16: Because I said, Hear me, lest they rejoice over me; they scoff at me when my feet waver.
38.17: I am prepared to suffer, and my sorrow is continually with me.
38.18: I will declare mine iniquity to thee; I will purify myself of my sins.
38.19: But mine enemies are strong and alert; and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
38.20: They reward me evil for good; they reproach me because I seek after good things.
38.21: Forsake me not, O LORD; O my God, be not far from me.
38.22: Abide to help me and save me.

39.1: I SAID, I will take heed to my ways that I sin not with my tongue; I will keep the words of my mouth under control while the wicked is before me.
39.2: I was dumb and sorrowful, I was wretched, I held myself aloof, even from good; and my sorrow was multiplied.
39.3: My heart was hot within me; and my body was on fire; then spoke I with my tongue,
39.4: LORD, show me mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know my destiny.
39.5: Behold, thou hast given my days a limit; and mine age is as nothing before thee; verily all men stand as a mere breath.
39.6: Because every man walks as an image, he disappears as a breath; he buries treasures and knows not who shall gather them.
39.7: Henceforth, what is my hope except in thee, O LORD?
39.8: Deliver thou me from all my transgressions; make me not the reproach of the unjust.
39.9: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth, because thou didst it.
39.10: Remove thy scourges from me; I am stricken by the blow of thy hand.
39.11: I am consumed by rebuke on account of my sins; thou dost chastise a man and dost remove his desires like stubble. Verily all men are like a breath.
39.12: Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears; for I am a dweller with thee and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
39.13: O deliver me, that I may rest in peace before I pass away and be no more.

40.1: I WAITED patiently for the LORD; and he turned towards me and heard my supplication.
40.2: He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the mire of destruction, and set my feet upon a rock and established my goings.
40.3: And he has put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God, that many shall see it and rejoice and trust in the LORD.
40.4: Blessed is the man whose trust is in the name of the LORD, and who returns not to vanity; neither to lying conversation.
40.5: Many are thy works which thou hast done for us, O LORD our God, and thy wonderful care for us; I have declared that they are too many to be numbered; there is no one like unto thee.
40.6: Sacrifices and offerings thou didst not desire; but as for me, I now have understanding; burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
40.7: Then said I, Lo, I come; in the beginning of the books, it is written of me,
40.8: I delight to do thy will, O my God; yea, thy law is within my heart.
40.9: I have preached thy righteousness in the great congregation; lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
40.10: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation; I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
40.11: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD; let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
40.12: For innumerable evils have surrounded me; mine iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of my head; and my heart fails me.
40.13: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; O LORD, continue to help me.
40.14: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame who wish me evil.
40.15: Let them be overthrown for their disgraceful conduct who say to me, Aha, aha!
40.16: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee; let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
40.17: But I am poor and needy; O my LORD, they have conspired against me; help me and deliver me; do not tarry, O my God.

41.1: BLESSED is he who looks after the poor; the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
41.2: The LORD will preserve him and keep him alive, and he shall bless him upon the earth; he will not deliver him into the hands of his enemies.
41.3: The LORD will strengthen him upon his sick bed; he will wholly recover from his illness.
41.4: I have said, Thou art my LORD, be merciful unto me and heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
41.5: Mine enemies speak evil of me: When shall he die, and his name perish?
41.6: When they come to see me, they speak falsely and their hearts devise evil; they go out into the street and gossip about me.
41.7: All that hate me whisper together about me; they devise evil against me.
41.8: They conceive unjust accusations against me; they say, Now that he lies sick in his bed, he shall rise up no more.
41.9: Yea, even the man who visits me, in whom I trust, who eats my bread and whom I trust, betrays me.
41.10: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me and heal me, that I may repay them.
41.11: By this I know that thou art pleased with me, because mine enemy doth not irk me.
41.12: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
41.13: Blessed is the LORD God of Israel from everlasting and to everlasting! Amen and Amen.

42.1: AS the hart pants after the water brook so pants my soul after thee, O LORD.
42.2: My soul thirsts after thee, O living God; when shall I come to see thy face?
42.3: My tears have been my bread day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is your God?
42.4: When I remember these things, my soul is agitated; therefore I will enter thy mighty citadel, even to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with the many people who rejoice.
42.5: Why are you troubled, O my soul? and why are you bewildered? Trust in God; for I shall yet praise him, the Saviour of my honour and my God.
42.6: My soul is troubled within me; therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, from the mount of Hermon and from the hill.
42.7: Deep calls to deep at the sound of thy waterfalls: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
42.8: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer to the living God.
42.9: I will say to God, Why hast thou forsaken me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of my enemies?
42.10: When my bones are broken, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is your God?
42.11: Why are you disturbed, O my soul? and why are you bewildered? Hope in God; for I shall yet praise him, the Saviour of my honor and my God.

43.1: JUDGE me, O God, and avenge my cause against a merciless people; O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
43.2: For thou art the God of my strength; why has thou forsaken me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
43.3: O send out thy light and thy truth; let them comfort me; let them bring me unto thy holy mountain and to thy tabernacle.
43.4: Then will I go before the altar of God, to God who makes me joyful with the joy of youth; yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God, my God.
43.5: Why are you disturbed, O my soul? and why are you sad within me? Hope in God; for I shall yet praise him, who is the Saviour of my honor and my God.

44.1: WE have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us what work thou hast wrought in their days, in the times of old;
44.2: How thou didst destroy the Gentiles with thy hand, and established thy people; how thou didst vex the kingdoms, and strengthened thy people.
44.3: For they inherited not the land by their sword, neither did their own arm save them; but thy right hand and thine arm and the light of thy countenance, because thou wast pleased with them.
44.4: Thou art my King, O God; for thou commandest deliverances for Jacob.
44.5: Through thee will we pierce our enemies; through thy name will we tread them under that hate us.
44.6: For we trust not in our bows; neither on our armour to save us.
44.7: But thou hast saved us from those who hate us, and hast put to shame our enemies.
44.8: We glorify thee, O God, all the day long, and praise thy name for ever.
44.9: But now thou hast forsaken us and put us to shame, and goest not forth with our armies:
44.10: But thou makest us to be defeated; and our enemies have plundered us.
44.11: Thou hast sold us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the Gentiles.
44.12: Thou hast sold thy people as a bargain, and dost not profit by their exchange.
44.13: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
44.14: Thou makest us a byword among the Gentiles, a shaking of the head among the nations.
44.15: All the day long my disgrace is before me, and the shame of my face has covered me,
44.16: Because of the voice of him who reproaches and blasphemes; and because of the enemy that avenges.
44.17: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
44.18: We have not turned back, neither have we swerved our steps from thy way;
44.19: For thou hast humbled us a second time in the land, and covered us with the shadow of death.
44.20: And yet we have not forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to stranger gods;
44.21: God will look into this thing, for he knows the secrets of the heart.
44.22: Yea, for thy sake are we killed every day; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
44.23: Awake and sleep not, O LORD; remember us and forsake us not.
44.24: Turn not thy face from us, and forget not our humiliation and our oppression;
44.25: For our soul is humbled down to the dust; our body touches the earth.
44.26: Arise to help us; redeem us for thy mercies' sake.

45.1: MY heart bubbles forth good news and I will tell my deeds to the king; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
45.2: You are fairer than the children of men; grace is poured into your lips; therefore God has blessed you for ever.
45.3: Gird your sword upon your thigh, O most mighty, with your glory and your majesty.
45.4: Your majesty is triumphant; ride upon the word of truth and meekness and righteousness; your law is upheld by reverence for your right hand.
45.5: Your arrows are sharp; let them pierce the heart of the king's enemies, and let the people fall under you.
45.6: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever; the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
45.7: You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
45.8: All your garments smell of myrrh and aloes and cassia, out of the magnificent temple whereby they have made you glad.
45.9: The king's daughter stands in glory, the queen stands at your right hand in gold of Ophir.
45.10: Hearken, O my daughter, and consider and incline your ear; forget also your own people and your father's house.
45.11: So shall the king greatly desire your beauty; for he is your lord; make obeisance to him.
45.12: And the daughter of Tyre shall worship him; even the rich among the people shall seek your presence with gifts.
45.13: All the glory of the king's daughter is from within; her clothing is adorned with fine gold.
45.14: She shall be brought to the king with gifts; and her virgin companions shall follow in her train.
45.15: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought; they shall enter into the king's palace.
45.16: Instead of your fathers shall be your sons; you shall make them princes in all the earth,
45.17: I will make your name to be remembered in all generations; therefore shall the people praise you for ever and ever.

46.1: GOD is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
46.2: Thou hast been with us always; therefore will we not fear when the earth quakes and mountains are shaken into the heart of the sea,
46.3: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the force thereof.
46.4: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of our God, The holy place of the most High.
46.5: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved; God shall help her in the early morning.
46.6: The heathen raged, the kingdoms trembled: he raised his voice, the earth quaked.
46.7: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge.
46.8: Come, behold the works of God, for he does wonders in the earth.
46.9: He makes wars to cease to the end of the earth; he breaks the bow and cuts the spear asunder; he burns the chariot in the fire.
46.10: Repent, and know that I am God; I am exalted among the heathen and I am exalted in the earth.
46.11: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge.

47.1: O CLAP your hands, all people; shout to God with the voice of triumph.
47.2: For the LORD is most high and reverenced; he is a great King over all the earth.
47.3: For he has subdued the Gentiles under us, and the nations under our feet.
47.4: He has chosen us for the inheritance, and for the glory of Jacob whom he loved.
47.5: God is gone up with glory, the LORD with the sound of a trumpet.
47.6: Sing praises to God; sing praises to our King.
47.7: For God is the King of all the earth; sing praises unto him.
47.8: God reigns over the heathen; God sits upon his holy throne.
47.9: The rulers of the Gentiles have returned to the God of Abraham; for the dominions of the earth belong to God and he is greatly exalted.

48.1: GREAT is our LORD, and exceedingly exalted in the city of our God and in his holy and glorious mountain.
48.2: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion on the slopes of the north, the city of the great King.
48.3: God shows his might in her walled cities.
48.4: For, lo, the kings were prepared, and they passed by together.
48.5: They saw it, and so they marvelled; they were frustrated and hastened away.
48.6: Fear took hold of them, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
48.7: With a violent storm, the ships of Tarshish shall be broken.
48.8: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of our God; God will establish it for ever.
48.9: We have trusted upon thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
48.10: As is thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth; thy right hand is full of righteousness.
48.11: Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad because of thy judgments, O LORD.
48.12: Circle Zion, and go round about her; count the towers thereof.
48.13: Mark well her strength and the depth of her bulwarks, that you may tell it to another generation.
48.14: For this God is our God for ever and ever; he will be our guide until death.

49.1: HEAR this, all people; give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
49.2: Children of earth and sons of men, rich and poor together.
49.3: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
49.4: I will incline my ear to parables; I will chant my proverbs upon the harp.
49.5: I will fear not in days of evil, when the iniquity of my enemies shall surround me,
49.6: They who trust in their own strength and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.
49.7: A brother cannot save a brother, nor can a man give to God a ransom for himself;
49.8: For the redemption of their souls is precious:
49.9: Do good for ever and you shall live for ever, and not see corruption.
49.10: But you will see wise men die; likewise the fool and the weak minded shall perish and leave their wealth to others.
49.11: Their graves shall be their only habitations for ever, and their dwelling places throughout generations; their marked graves will be their only remembrance on earth.
49.12: Nevertheless, such a man is not sustained by his honour; his end will be as the beasts, and he will perish.
49.13: This their way is their folly; in the end, demented, they will graze like cattle.
49.14: Like sheep they are consigned to the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; the grave shall consume their beauty, and they shall be cast out from their glory.
49.15: But God will redeem my soul; from the power of the grave he will raise me up.
49.16: Be not afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
49.17: For when he dies he shall carry nothing away; neither shall his glory descend after him.
49.18: For while he lived, he lived comfortably; he praised you when you favored him.
49.19: His end shall be as his father's was before him; they shall never see light.
49.20: Man cannot depend upon his honor for consolation, for if he does, he resembles the wild beasts.

50.1: THE God of gods, the LORD, has spoken and called the earth from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.
50.2: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined.
50.3: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence; a fire shall consume before him, and it shall flame round about him greatly.
50.4: He shall call to the heavens from above and to the earth, that he may judge his people.
50.5: Gather unto him, O you, his saints, those that have made a covenant with him by sacrifice.
50.6: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness; for God himself is judge.
50.7: Hear, O my people, and I will speak to you; O Israel, I will testify to thee: I am God, even your God.
50.8: I reproved you not for your sacrifices or your burnt offerings; they are continually before me.
50.9: I will take no bullocks out of your house nor he-goats out of your folds.
50.10: For all the beasts of the forest are mine, and the cattle and the oxen upon the hills.
50.11: I know all the fowls of the air; and the wild beasts of the desert are mine.
50.12: If I were hungry, I should not tell you; for the world is mine and the fulness thereof.
50.13: I eat not the flesh of bulls, neither do I drink the blood of goats.
50.14: Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving; and fulfil your vows to the most High.
50.15: Call upon me in the day of trouble; I will strengthen you, and you shall glorify me.
50.16: But to the sinner, God says, How have you followed the books of my law? You have observed my covenant lightly,
50.17: Seeing that you hate my instruction and cast my words behind you.
50.18: When you saw a thief, you joined with him, and you have been a partaker with adulterers.
50.19: You have given your mouth to evil and your tongue speaks deceit.
50.20: You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
50.21: All of these things have you done, and I kept silence; you thought that I was wicked like you; but I will reprove you, and correct these sins before your eyes.
50.22: Now understand this, O you who forget God, lest you be crushed and there be none to deliver.
50.23: Whosoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me; and to him will I show the way of the salvation of our God.

51.1: HAVE mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness; according to the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my sins.
51.2: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin;
51.3: For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.
51.4: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done that which is evil in thy sight; for thou wilt be justified in thy reproof, triumphant in thy judgments.
51.5: For behold, I was formed in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.
51.6: Behold, thou desirest truth, and the hidden things of thy wisdom thou hast made known to me.
51.7: Sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
51.8: Satisfy me with thy joy and gladness, that my broken spirit may rejoice.
51.9: Turn thy face away from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
51.10: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
51.11: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy glorious spirit,
51.13: Then will I teach transgressors thy way, and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
51.14: Deliver me from bloodshedding, O God, thou God of my salvation, and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
51.15: O LORD, open thou my lips, and my mouth shall show forth thy praise;
51.16: For thou desirest not sacrifice; thou &lightest not in burnt offerings.
51.17: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
51.18: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion; build the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then shall they offer gifts upon thine altar.

52.1: WHY do you boast of evil, O mighty man? Your tongue devises injustices against the innocent every day.
52.2: It is like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
52.3: You love evil more than good, and lying rather than speaking righteousness.
52.4: You love all that speak evil and all deceitful tongues;
52.5: Therefore, God shall overthrow you, and he shall root you out of your dwelling place, and out of the land of the living.
52.6: Then shall the righteous see and rejoice, and shall trust in the LORD;
52.7: And they shall say, Lo, this is the man who trusted not in God; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and boasted in his possessions.
52.8: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I have trusted in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
52.9: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it; and I will proclaim thy name before thy saints for generations.

53.1: THE fool has said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and abominable in their iniquities; and there is none that does good.
53.2: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
53.3: Every one of them has gone astray; they are altogether become filthy; there is none that does good, no, not one.
53.4: These people no longer recognize evil; they have consumed my people like bread; they have no respect for God.
53.5: There they feared where no fear was; for God has scattered the bones of hypocrites; they have been ashamed, because God has despised them.
53.6: Who out of Zion will give salvation to Israel? When God brings back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice and Israel shall be glad.

54.1: SAVE me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength,
54.2: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
54.3: For strangers are risen up against me, and the mighty seek after my life; they have disregarded thee, O God.
54.4: Behold, God is my helper; the LORD sustains my soul.
54.5: Bring disaster to mine enemies; silence them in thy truth.
54.6: I will freely sacrifice to thee; I will praise thy name, O LORD, for it is good;
54.7: For thou hast delivered me out of all troubles; and mine eye hath seen mine enemies defeated.

55.1: GIVE ear to my prayer, O God; and reject not my supplication.
55.2: Hear me and answer me; return to my cry and incline to me,
55.3: Because of mine enemies, because of the oppression of the wicked; for they have devised iniquity against me, and reproached me.
55.4: My heart is greatly pained within me; and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
55.5: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and the shadow of death has overwhelmed me.
55.6: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! Then would I fly away and be at rest.
55.7: Lo, then I would fly far off and dwell in the wilderness.
55.8: I would wait for him that will save me from the windy storm and the tempest.
55.9: Destroy, O LORD, and render useless their tongues; for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
55.10: Day and night they go about it, around its walls; injustice and mischief are in the midst of it.
55.11: Wickedness is in the midst of it; deceit and guile depart not from its streets.
55.12: For it was not mine enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it; neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him;
55.13: But it was you, a man mine equal, my kinsman, and my friend.
55.14: We ate a meal together in the house of God, and we walked in harmony.
55.15: Bring death upon them; bury them alive in the grave, because there is evil among them.
55.16: As for me, I will call upon God; and God shall save me.
55.17: At evening and in the morning and at noon will I pray and cry aloud; and he shall hear my voice.
55.18: Deliver my soul from those who have been too wise for me, from those who have opposed me continuously.
55.19: God, even the Eternal one, shall hear and humble them. With them also there are no changes; therefore they fear not God.
55.20: They have put forth their hands against their neighbours, they have broken his covenant.
55.21: They were afraid because of the anger in his countenance and the wrath in his heart; his words were smoother than butter, yet were they sharp like the point of a spear.
55.22: Cast your worries upon the LORD and he will sustain you; he will never suffer the righteous to fear want.
55.23: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction; bloody and deceitful men shall not live out their days; but I will trust in thee.

56.1: BE merciful to me, O God; for man has trodden me under foot; all the day long the fighting oppresses me.
56.2: Mine enemies have daily trodden me under foot; for many warriors have risen against me.
56.3: I fear not during the day, because I trust in thee.
56.4: In God I will be glorified, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what man can do to me.
56.5: All the day long they conspired against me and they devised evil against me.
56.6: They will wait in hiding, they will watch my steps, inasmuch as they wish for my death.
56.7: He has no deliverer, they have said. Condemn them with the condemnation of the Gentiles.
56.8: O God, I have declared my faith unto thee; record thou my tears before thee in thy book.
56.9: Then shall mine enemies turn back; and I will know I have a God.
56.10: In God will I praise his word; in the LORD will I praise his word.
56.11: In God have I put my trust; I will not be afraid what man can do to me.
56.12: To thee shall I perform my vows, O God; I will offer them to thee with thank offering.
56.13: For thou hast delivered my soul from death and my feet from stumbling, that I may be pleasing in thy sight, O God, in the land of the living.

57.1: BE merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me; for my soul trusts in thee; yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge until these calamities be overpast.
57.2: I will cry to God most High, to God my Saviour.
57.3: For he has sent from heaven and delivered me; he has put mine enemies to shame. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
57.4: He has delivered my life from the vicious as I slept in fear, and from the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongues sharp swords.
57.5: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
57.6: They have prepared a net for my feet; they have digged a pit for my soul, into the midst of which they themselves have fallen.
57.7: My heart is made ready, O God, my heart is ready; I will sing and give praise in my glory.
57.8: Awake, my harp; awake, psaltery and harp; I myself will awake early.
57.9: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people; I will sing unto thy name among the nations.
57.10: For thy mercy is exalted to the sky and thy faithfulness to the heavens.
57.11: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.

58.1: DO you indeed speak righteousness. O congregation? do you judge uprightly, O sons of men?
58.2: Behold you all speak evil on earth, and your hands are soiled with injustice.
58.3: The wicked are known from the womb; they go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
58.4: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent; they are like the deaf adder that stops its ear,
58.5: And will not listen to the voice of the whisperer, neither to the charmer nor to the wise.
58.6: Break their teeth in their mouths, O God; pull out the fangs of the lions, O LORD.
58.7: Let them be rejected as water which is contaminated; let God shoot his arrows until the wicked are destroyed.
58.8: Like the wax that melts, and drips before the fire, let them be destroyed: fire has fallen from heaven and they did not see; the light of truth has been given and they did not understand.
58.9: Let their thorns be increased, and fear of wrath shake them violently.
58.10: The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance: he shall wash his hands in the blood of the wicked,
58.11: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous; verily there is a God that judges in the earth.

59.1: DELIVER me from mine enemies, O God; defend me from them that rise up against me.
59.2: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
59.3: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul; evil have they multiplied against me; not because I have transgressed or because I have sinned, O LORD.
59.4: They run and prepare themselves against me without considering whether I have been at fault;
59.5: Awake to help me, and behold, O thou LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the nations, and spare not any wicked transgressors.
59.6: They return at evening; they make a noise like dogs, and go round about the city.
59.7: Behold, they belch out with their mouths; swords are in their lips; for who, say they, does care?
59.8: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the nations in derision.
59.9: To thee shall I give praise, O God, for thou art my defense.
59.10: O God, thy lovingkindness has preceded me; God has let me live to see my enemies avenged.
59.11: Spare them for a living example, lest my people forget; but scatter them by thy power, and bring them down, O LORD my hope.
59.12: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips. let them even be taken in their pride; for it is cursing and lying that they speak.
59.13: Consume them in thy wrath, consume them, that they be no more, that they may know that God rules over Jacob and over the ends of the earth.
59.14: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like dogs, and go round about the city.
59.15: Let them be hungry and not be filled, neither let them find a lodging place.
59.16: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning; for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
59.17: Unto thee, O God, will I sing; for thou art God of my refuge and the God of my mercy.

60.1: O GOD, thou hast forsaken us, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased with us; O turn thyself to us again.
60.2: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it; heal the breaches thereof, for it hath weakened.
60.3: Thou hast shown thy people hardships; thou hast made us to drink the dregs of wine.
60.4: Thou hast wrought a miracle to them that reverence thee, so that they need not flee from the bow.
60.5: That thy beloved may be prepared, save with thy right hand, and hear me.
60.6: God has spoken in his holiness: I will be strong, I will divide Shechem and mete out the valley of Succoth.
60.7: Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my king.
60.8: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I levy tribute; over Philistia will I triumph.
60.9: Who will lead me into Edom? Who will bring me into the strong city?
60.10: For behold, O God, thou hadst cast us off, and thou didst not go before us with our armies.
60.11: Give us strength against our enemies; for vain is the help of man.
60.12: Through God we shall do valiantly; for he it is who shall tread down our enemies.

61.1: HEAR my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.
61.2: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed; for thou hast led me upon a rock and hast comforted me.
61.3: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from my enemies,
61.4: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever; I will make my refuge the shadow of thy wings.
61.5: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows; thou hast given an inheritance to them that revere thy name.
61.6: Thou hast added days to the days of the king, and his years as many generations.
61.7: He shall be established before God for ever; mercy and justice shall preserve him.
61.8: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, when daily I fulfil my vows.

62.1: MY soul waits upon God; from him comes my salvation.
62.2: He only is my God and my salvation; he is my great defense; I shall not be moved.
62.3: How long will you threaten a man so that you may kill him? Like a crumbling wall shall you be and as a tottering fence.
62.4: For you have thought to cast him down from his excellency; you delight in lies; you bless with your mouths, but curse with your hearts.
62.5: My soul, wait only upon God; for my salvation is from him.
62.6: He only is my God and my salvation; he is my defense; I shall not be moved.
62.7: In God is my salvation and my glory; God is my strength, my refuge, and my hope.
62.8: Trust in him at all times; you people, pour out your hearts before him; God is a refuge for us.
62.9: Surely all untrue men are like vapor; when they are placed in the balance, they are found wanting.
62.10: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery; if riches increase, let not your heart rejoice over them.
62.11: God has said this once; twice have I heard this; that power belongs unto God.
62.12: Also unto thee, O LORD, belongs mercy; for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
