106.20: Thus they changed their Glorious One into the likeness of an ox that eats grass.
106.21: They forgot God their Saviour, who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red Sea.
106.23: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
106.24: Yea, they despised the desired land, they believed not his word,
106.25: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not to the voice of the LORD.
106.26: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to scatter them among the Gentiles,
106.27: To scatter their descendants also among the nations, and to lose them in the lands.
106.28: They worshipped also the idols of Baal-peor, and ate sacrifices offered for the dead.
106.29: Thus they provoked him to anger with their acts; they made him angry with their images, and the plague came upon them suddenly.
106.30: Then Phinehas stood up and prayed, and so the plague was stopped.
106.31: And that was counted to him for a victory to all generations for evermore.
106.32: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes,
106.33: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spoke unadvisedly with his lips.
106.34: And they did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them;
106.35: But they were mingled among the Gentiles, and learned their works.
106.36: And they served their idols, which were a snare to them.
106.37: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons,
106.38: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with blood.
106.39: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went awhoring with their own inventions.
106.40: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
106.41: And he gave them into the hand of the Gentiles; and they that hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Their enemies also subdued them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
106.43: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were humbled for their iniquity.
106.44: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction and heard their prayer.
106.45: And he remembered his covenant, and pitied them, and led them according to the multitude of his mercies.
106.46: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
106.47: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the nations, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and be glorified in thine inheritance.
106.48: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting; and let all the people say, Amen and Amen. Praise the LORD.

107.1: O GIVE thanks to the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
107.2: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he has redeemed from the hand of the oppressor,
107.3: And gathered out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the islands in the sea.
107.4: They were lost in the wilderness in a place without water; they found not the right way to an inhabited town.
107.5: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
107.6: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses,
107.7: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to inhabited villages.
107.8: Let the righteous of the LORD give thanks to him; for his mercies are upon the children of men!
107.9: For he satisfies the longing soul, and fills the hungry soul with goodness,
107.10: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;
107.11: Because they murmured against the words of God, and scorned the counsel of the most High;
107.12: Therefore he brought down their hearts with labor; they became weak and there was none to help.
107.13: Then they prayed to the LORD in their trouble and he saved them out of their distresses.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their bands asunder.
107.15: Let the righteous of the LORD give thanks to him; for his mercies are upon the children of men.
107.16: For he has broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron asunder.
107.17: He helped them out of the way of their sins, he relieved them of their afflictions.
107.18: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, and they drew near to the gates of death.
107.19: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
107.20: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from destruction.
107.21: Let the righteous of the LORD give thanks to him, for his mercies are upon the children of men!
107.22: Sacrifice to him the sacrifices of praise, and glorify him, O you, his servants, for his wonders.
107.23: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters,
107.24: These see the works of the LORD and his wonders in the deep.
107.25: For he commands and raises the stormy wind, which lifts up the waves thereof.
107.26: They mount up to the sky; then they go down again to the depths; their soul is troubled within them.
107.27: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wit's end.
107.28: Then they cry to the LORD in their trouble and he brings them out of their distresses.
107.29: He makes the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
107.30: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he brings them to their desired haven.
107.31: Let the righteous of the LORD give thanks to him; for his mercies are upon the children of men.
107.32: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
107.33: He turns rivers into a wilderness and the water-springs into dry ground,
107.34: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
107.35: He turns the wilderness into pools of water and dry land into watersprings.
107.36: And there he makes the hungry to dwell, that they may build villages and settle,
107.37: And sow the fields and plant vineyards, and eat of the fruits thereof.
107.38: He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffers not their cattle to decrease.
107.39: Again, they are diminished and humbled through oppression, affliction, and misery.
107.40: He pours contempt upon rulers, and causes them to wander in the wilderness where there is no way.
107.41: He strengthens the poor and he multiplies their families like a flock.
107.42: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice; and all the ungodly shall shut their mouths.
107.43: Whosoever is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.

108.1: O GOD, my heart is ready, my heart is ready; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
108.2: Awake, my harp; awake, psaltery and harp; I myself will awake early.
108.3: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people; and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
108.4: For thy mercy is great to the heavens; and thy truth reaches to the heaven of heavens.
108.5: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory above all the earth,
108.6: That thy beloved may be delivered; save me with thy right hand, and answer me.
108.7: God has spoken in his holiness: I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem and mete out the valley of Succoth.
108.8: Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine, Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my king;
108.9: Moab is my washpot; Edom will loosen my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
108.10: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
108.11: Wilt not thou, O God, who cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
108.12: Give us strength against our enemies; for vain is the help of man.
108.13: Through God we shall do valiantly; for he it is who shall tread down our enemies.

109.1: HOLD not thy peace, O God of my praise;
109.2: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me;
109.3: They have spoken against me with a lying tongue and with a hateful voice, and have fought against me without a cause.
109.4: For my love they reproach me; but I have prayed for them.
109.5: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
109.6: Command thou vengeance against them; and let Satan stand at their right hand.
109.7: When they shall be judged, let them be condemned, and let their prayer become sin.
109.8: Let their days be few; and let others take what they have stored.
109.9: Let their children be fatherless and their wives widows.
109.10: Let their children be continually vagabonds, and beg; let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
109.11: Let the creditor take all that they have, and let the strangers make them to be weakened.
109.12: Let there be none to extend mercy unto them; neither let there be any to pity their fatherless children.
109.13: Let their end be destruction, and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
109.14: Let the iniquity of their fathers be remembered; and let not the sin of their mothers be blotted out.
109.15: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth,
109.16: Because they remembered not to show mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy, and him whose heart is sorrowful to death.
109.17: They loved cursing, and delighted not in blessings.
109.18: They clothed themselves with cursing like armor; it penetrated into them like water, like oil into their bones.
109.19: Let it be to them like a mantle which covers them, and like a girdle wherewith they are girded continually.
109.20: These are the deeds of those who reproach the LORD, and of those who speak evil against me.
109.21: But thou, O LORD, do good to me for thy name's sake; because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
109.22: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is troubled within me.
109.23: I am bent like the shadow when it declines; I am tossed up and down as the locust.
109.24: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh wastes away.
109.25: And I became also a reproach to them; when they looked upon me they shook their heads.
109.26: Help me, O LORD my God; O save me according to thy mercy,
109.27: That they may know that this is thy hand, that thou, LORD, hast done it.
109.28: Let them be cursed; but thou shalt be blessed, and let thou thy servant rejoice.
109.29: Let them that had a grudge against me be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with it as with a mantle.
109.30: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
109.31: He has stood at the right hand of the poor, to save his soul from judgment.

110.1: THE LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
110.2: The LORD will send forth the sceptre of his power out of Zion, and he will rule over thine enemies.
110.3: Thy people shall he glorious in the day of thy power; arrayed in the beauty of holiness from the womb, I have begotten thee as a child from the ages.
110.4: The LORD has sworn, and will not lie, You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
110.5: The LORD at your right hand will defeat the kings in the day of his wrath.
110.6: He will judge among the nations, he will count the slain; he will cut off the heads of many on earth.
110.7: He will drink of the brook in the way; therefore he will lift up his head.

111.1: PRAISE the LORD. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.
111.2: The works of the LORD are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
111.3: His works are great and glorious, and his righteousness endures for ever.
111.4: He has made his wonderful works to be remembered; the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.
111.5: He has given food to them that revere him; he will ever be mindful of his covenant.
111.6: He has shown his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the Gentiles.
111.7: The works of his hands are truth and justice, and they endure for ever and ever.
111.8: All his commandments are sure, and are done in righteousness and truth.
111.9: He has sent salvation to his people; his covenant shall be remembered for ever; holy and revered is his name.
111.10: The reverence of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; a good understanding have all they that do his commandments; his praise endures for ever.

112.1: PRAISE the LORD. Blessed is the man who fears the LORD, who is vigilant in his commandments.
112.2: His descendants shall be mighty upon earth; he shall be blessed in the generation of the upright.
112.3: Wealth and riches shall be in his house; and his righteousness endures for ever.
112.4: To the upright there shines a light in the darkness; he is gracious and full of compassion upon the righteous.
112.5: Blessed is the man who shows mercy and lends; he shall proclaim his words with judgment.
112.6: Surely he shall not be moved for ever; the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
112.7: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.
112.8: His heart is strengthened; he shall not be afraid, until he sees his desire upon his enemies.
112.9: He has given generously, he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures for ever and ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.
112.10: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash his teeth and be confounded; the desire of the wicked shall perish.

113.1: PRAISE the LORD. Praise, O you servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.
113.2: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
113.3: From the rising of the sun to the going down of the same the LORD'S name is great.
113.4: The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like to the LORD our God, who dwells on high,
113.6: Yet who beholds the things that are in the deep, in heaven, and in the earth!
113.7: He raises up the poor out of the dunghill,
113.8: That he may set him with the princes of the people.
113.9: He makes the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD.

114.1: WHEN Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of a foreign language,
114.2: Judah was his sanctuary and Israel his glory.
114.3: The sea saw it and fled; Jordan was driven back.
114.4: The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like lambs of the flock.
114.5: What ails you, O you sea, that you fled? You Jordan, that you were driven back?
114.6: You mountains, that you skipped like rams; and you hills, like lambs of the flock?
114.7: Tremble, earth, at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114.8: Who turned the rock into pools of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

115.1: NOT unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory for thy mercy and for thy truth's sake.
115.2: Wherefore the Gentiles have no cause to say, Where is now their God?
115.3: But our God is in the heavens; he has done whatever he pleased.
115.4: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
115.5: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;
115.6: They have ears, but they hear not; noses have they, but they smell not;
115.7: They have hands, but they feel not; feet have they, but they walk not; neither speak they through their throats.
115.8: Let them that make them become like them; and every one that trusts in them.
115.9: The house of Israel trusts in the LORD; he is their help and their shield.
115.10: The house of Aaron trusts in the LORD; he is their help and their shield.
115.11: You who reverence the LORD, trust in the LORD; he is their help and their shield.
115.12: The LORD has been mindful of us; he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13: The LORD will bless them that worship him, both small and great.
115.14: The LORD will increase you more and more, you and your children.
115.15: You are blessed of the LORD who made heaven and earth.
115.16: The heavens, even the heavens, are the LORD'S; but the earth has he given to the children of men.
115.17: The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into darkness.
115.18: But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.

116.1: I LOVE the LORD, because he will hear the voice of my supplication.
116.2: He will incline his ear to me in the day when I call upon him.
116.3: The pangs of death have encompassed me, and the pains of Sheol have found me; I found trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then called I upon the name of the LORD; O LORD, deliver my soul.
116.5: Thou art merciful, O LORD, and righteous; O God, thou art merciful.
116.6: The LORD preserves the little ones; he humbled me and saved me.
116.7: Return to your rest, O my soul; for the LORD has dealt bountifully with you.
116.8: For he has delivered my soul from death, and my feet from falling.
116.9: I will be acceptable to thee, O LORD, in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed, therefore have I spoken; I have been humbled exceedingly:
116.11: I said in my stupidity, All men are liars.
116.12: What shall I render to the LORD for all his benefits toward me?
116.13: I will take the cup of salvation and call upon the name of the LORD.
116.14: I will pay my vows to the LORD now in the presence of all the people.
116.15: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.
116.16: O LORD, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thy handmaid; thou hast loosed my bonds.
116.17: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving and will call upon the name of the LORD.
116.18: I will pay my vows to the LORD now in the presence of all the people,
116.19: In the courts of the LORD'S house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

117.1: PRAISE the LORD, all you nations; praise him, all you people.
117.2: For his merciful kindness is great toward us; and the truth of the LORD endures for ever. Praise the LORD.

118.1: O GIVE thanks to the LORD; for he is good and his mercy endures for ever.
118.2: Let Israel now say that his mercy endures for ever.
118.3: Let the house of Aaron now say that his mercy endures for ever.
118.4: Let them that worship the LORD say that his mercy endures for ever.
118.5: Out of my distress I called upon the LORD; the LORD answered me and relieved me.
118.6: The LORD is my help, I will not fear; what can man do to me?
118.7: The LORD is my helper; therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.
118.8: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
118.9: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
118.10: All nations surrounded me; but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
118.11: They surrounded me; yea, they surrounded me; but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
118.12: They surrounded me like hornets; they are quenched like the fire of stubble; for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
118.13: I have been repelled that I might be overthrown and fall; but the LORD helped me.
118.14: The LORD is my strength and song, and has become my salvation.
118.15: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.16: The right hand of the LORD has exalted me; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.17: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
118.18: The LORD has chastened me severely; but he has not given me over to death.
118.19: Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD.
118.20: This is the gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
118.21: I will give thanks to thee; for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
118.22: The stone which the builders rejected has become the headstone of the corner.
118.23: This is the LORD'S doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
118.24: This is the day which the LORD has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: Save me, O LORD; O LORD, deliver me.
118.26: Blessed be he that comes in the name of the LORD; we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
118.27: O LORD, our God, enlighten us; bind our festival processions as an unbroken chain, even to the horns of the altar.
118.28: Thou art my God, and I will give thanks to thee; thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
118.29: O give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.

119.1: ALEPH. BLESSED are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
119.2: Blessed are they who keep his testimonies, and seek him with the whole heart.
119.3: They also do no iniquity; they walk in his ways.
119.4: Thou hast commanded them to keep thy precepts diligently.
119.5: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
119.6: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have observed all thy commandments.
119.7: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
119.8: I will keep thy statutes; O forsake me not utterly.
119.9: BETH. With what shall a young man cleanse his way in order that he may observe thy commandments?
119.10: With my whole heart have I sought thee; O let me not wander from thy commandments.
119.11: Thy words have I impressed on my heart, that I might not sin against thee.
119.12: Blessed art thou, O LORD; teach me thy statutes.
119.13: With my lips have I repeated all thy righteous judgments.
119.14: I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies, more than in all riches.
119.15: I have meditated in thy commandments, and am familiar with thy ways.
119.16: I have meditated in thy law in order that I may not forget thy words.
119.17: GAMEL. Answer thy servant, that I may live and keep thy words.
119.18: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.
119.19: I am a sojourner with thee; hide not thy commandments from me.
119.20: My soul is pleased and desires thy judgments at all times.
119.21: Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles, and cursed are those who go astray from thy commandments.
119.22: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.
119.23: The ungodly sat and plotted against me; but I meditated in thy statutes.
119.24: I have meditated also in thy testimonies and in thy good counsel.
119.25: DALETH. My soul cleaves to the dust; quicken me according to thy word.
119.26: I have declared my ways and thou heardest me; teach me thy law.
119.27: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts; so shall I meditate on thy wondrous works.
119.28: My soul is vexed from meditation; quicken me according to thy word.
119.29: Remove from me the practices of the wicked, and teach me thy law.
119.30: I have chosen the way of thy truth: thy judgments have delighted me.
119.31: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.
119.32: I have walked in the way of thy commandments, because thou hast made me joyful.
119.33: HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy commandments; and I shall keep them unto the end.
119.34: Give me understanding and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
119.35: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
119.36: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to fables.
119.37: Turn away mine eyes that they may not behold falsehood; and quicken thou me in thy way.
119.38: Strengthen thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thee.
119.39: Turn away my reproach: because thy judgments are good.
119.40: Behold, I have delighted in thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.
119.41: VAU. Let thy mercies come also to me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.
119.42: So shall I have wherewith to answer him who reproaches me; for I trust in thy word.
119.43: Let not the word of truth depart from my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.
119.44: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.
119.45: And I will walk at liberty because I have been delighted in thy commandments.
119.46: I will speak truthfully before kings, and will not be ashamed.
119.47: And I will meditate on thy commandments, which I have loved.
119.48: My hands also will I lift up to thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy commandments, and I will be glorified in thy faith.
119.49: ZEN. Remember thy word to thy servant, upon which thou hast made me to hope.
119.50: In it have I been comforted in my humiliation; for thy word has quickened me.
119.51: The ungodly have oppressed me greatly; yet have I not swerved from thy law.
119.52: I have remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD, and have been comforted; they have become a guide to me.
119.53: Horror has taken hold of me because of the wicked who forsake thy law.
119.54: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
119.55: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
119.56: I have been comforted because I kept thy commandments.
119.57: KHETH. On the LORD'S business have I meditated, that I may keep thy commandments.
119.58: I entreated thy favor with my whole heart; save me according to thy word.
119.59: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet to thy paths.
119.60: I prepared myself and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
119.61: The bands of the wicked have beset me; but I have not strayed from thy law.
119.62: At midnight I rise to give thanks to thee because of thy righteous judgments.
119.63: I am a friend of all them that worship thee, and of them that keep thy commandments.
119.64: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy; teach me thy statutes.
119.65: TETH. Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according to thy word.
119.66: Teach me good judgment, grace, and knowledge; for I have believed thy commandments.
119.67: Even before I was humbled I believed; and I kept thy word.
119.68: Thou art good, O LORD, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.
119.69: The injustice of the proud has multiplied; but I keep thy commandments with my whole heart.
119.70: Their hearts are stubborn; but I keep thy law.
119.71: It is good for me that I have been humbled, that I might learn thy statutes.
119.72: The law of thy mouth is better to me than thousands of things of gold and silver.
119.73: YOTH. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me; teach me thy law,
119.74: So that those who revere thee may see and rejoice, because I have hoped in thy word.
119.75: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in thy faithfulness hast humbled me.
119.76: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word to thy servant.
119.77: Let thy tender mercies come to me, that I may live; for I have been taught thy law.
119.78: Let the wicked be ashamed, for they have humbled me unjustly; but I have meditated in thy precepts.
119.79: Let those who reverence thee turn unto me, and those who have known thy testimonies.
119.80: Let my heart meditate in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.
119.81: CAPH. My soul hath longed for thy salvation, and I hope in thy word.
119.82: Mine eyes wait for thy word, when thou wilt comfort me.
119.83: For I have suffered all disgrace; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
119.84: How many are the days of thy servant? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
119.85: The wicked have digged a pit for me, which is not in accord with thy law.
119.86: All thy commandments are trustworthy; yet the wicked persecute me.
119.87: They had almost destroyed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy commandments.
119.88: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.
119.89: LAMED. For ever thou art, O LORD; thy word is established in heaven.
119.90: Thy faithfulness is to all generations; thou hast established the earth, and it abides.
119.91: They continue this day according to thine ordinances; for all are thy servants.
119.92: Unless thy law had been my meditation, I should then have perished in mine affliction.
119.93: I will never forget thy commandments, because they are my very life.
119.94: I am thine, deliver me; for I have kept thy commandments.
119.95: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me; but I understand thy testimonies.
119.96: I have seen the futility of all things; but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
119.97: MEM. O how love I thy law! It is my meditation all the day.
119.98: Make me wiser than mine enemies, because I have obeyed thy commandments.
119.99: Give me more understanding than all my teachers; for thy testimonies are my meditation.
119.100: I understand more than the elders, because I keep thy statutes.
119.101: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy commandments.
119.102: I have not departed from thy judgments; for thou hast taught me.
119.103: How sweet are thy words to the taste! yea, sweeter than honey to the mouth!
119.104: I have meditated on thy commandments; therefore I hate the way of the wicked.
119.105: NUN. Thy word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
119.106: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
119.107: I am afflicted very much; quicken me, O LORD, according to thy word.
119.108: With the words of my mouth be pleased, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.
119.109: My soul is continually in thy hands; I do not forget thy law.
119.110: Sinners have laid a snare for me; yet I erred not from thy commandments.
119.111: Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
119.112: I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes truly, even to the end.
119.113: SEMKETH. I hate the wicked; but thy law do I love.
119.114: Thou art my shelter and my refuge: I hope in thy word.
119.115: Depart from me, O you evildoers, that I may keep the commandments of my God.
119.116: Uphold me according to thy word, and I shall live; and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
119.117: Help me and I shall be safe, and I will be continually mindful of thy commandments.
119.118: Thou hast rejected all them that stray from thee; for their thought is ungodly.
119.119: Sustain me, and I shall be safe, and I will always meditate on thy commandments.
119.120: My flesh shrinks for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
119.121: AI. O thou that doeth judgment and justice, leave me not in the hand of mine oppressors.
119.122: Comfort thy servant with goodness; let not the proud slander me.
119.123: Mine eyes long for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.
119.124: Deal with thy servant according to thy mercies, and teach me thy law.
119.125: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
119.126: It is time to serve the LORD; for they have nullified thy law.
119.127: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold, yea, above precious stones.
119.128: Therefore I love all thy commandments; and I hate every way of the wicked.
119.129: PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore doth my soul keep them.
119.130: Make plain thy word and enlighten and give understanding to the simple.
119.131: I opened my mouth, and panted; for I longed for thy commandments.
119.132: Look upon me, and be merciful to me, because I love thy name.
119.133: Direct my steps in thy path; let not the wicked have dominion over me.
119.134: Deliver me from the oppression of man; so will I keep thy statutes.
119.135: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy law.
119.136: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.
119.137: ZADDI. Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.
119.138: Thou hast commanded thy testimony in righteousness and faithfulness.
119.139: Zeal hath consumed me because thine enemies have forgotten thy word.
119.140: Thy word is very pure; therefore thy servant loves it.
119.141: I am small and despised; yet I do not forget thy commandments.
119.142: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is truth.
119.143: Trouble and anguish have taken hold of me; yet I meditate on thy commandments.
119.144: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting; give me understanding, and I shall live.
119.145: KOPH. I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD; I will keep thy statutes.
119.146: I cried to thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
119.147: I arose at the dawn of the morning, and cried; I hoped in thy word.
119.148: Mine eyes open before the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.
119.149: Hear my voice according to thy lovingkindness, O LORD; quicken me according to thy judgment.
119.150: They draw near who follow after mischief; they are far from thy law.
119.151: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth. Mine eyes open before the night watch to meditate on thy word.
119.152: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
119.153: RESH. Consider mine affliction, and deliver me; for I do not forget thy law.
119.154: Judge my case, and deliver me; quicken me according to thy word.
119.155: Salvation is far from the wicked; for they seek not thy statutes.
119.156: Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD; quicken me according to thy judgments.
119.157: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.
119.158: I beheld the transgressors and I knew they had not kept thy word.
119.159: Consider how I love thy commandments; quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.
119.160: The foundation of thy word is truth; and every one of thy righteous judgments endures for ever.
119.161: SHEEN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause; but my heart stands in awe of thy word.
119.162: I rejoice at thy word, as one that finds great spoil.
119.163: I hate and despise evil; but thy law do I love.
119.164: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.
119.165: Great peace have they which love thy law; and they shall have no infirmity.
119.166: LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
119.167: My soul has kept thy testimonies, and I love them exceedingly.
119.168: I have kept thy commandments and thy testimonies; for all my ways are before thee.
119.169: TAU. Let my cry come before thee, O LORD; save me according to thy word.
119.170: Let my supplication come before thee; deliver me according to thy word.
119.171: My tongue shall speak of thy word; for all thy commandments are righteous.
119.172: My lips shall speak of thy praise when thou hast taught me thy commandments.
119.173: Let thine hand help me; for I have delighted in thy statutes.
119.174: I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and I meditate on thy law.
119.175: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
119.176: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.

120.1: IN my distress I cried to the LORD, and he heard me.
120.2: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lips of the ungodly and from deceitful tongues.
120.3: What shall be given to you? or what shall be added to you, you deceitful tongues?
120.4: The arrows of the mighty are sharp; they are as hot coals of oak.
120.5: Woe is me, that my sojourn is prolonged, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
120.6: My soul has long dwelt with him that hates peace.
120.7: I am for peace; but when I speak they fight with me.

121.1: I WILL lift up mine eyes to the mountain from whence comes my help.
121.2: My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.
121.3: He will not allow your foot to be moved; he who keeps you will not slumber.
121.4: Behold, he who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5: The LORD is your keeper; the LORD will protect you with his right hand.
121.6: The sun shall not smite you by day, nor the moon by night.
121.7: The LORD will preserve you from all evil; he will preserve your soul.
121.8: The LORD will preserve your going out and your coming in from this time forth and even for evermore.

122.1: I WAS glad when they said to me, Let us go to the house of the LORD.
122.2: My feet shall stand within your gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem is built like a city that is surrounded by a wall,
122.4: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to the testimony of Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD.
122.5: For there are thrones of judgment set, the thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Greet Jerusalem with peace; they shall prosper who love you.
122.7: Peace be within your walls and prosperity within your palaces.
122.8: For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within you.
122.9: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your good.

123.1: TO thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heaven.
123.2: Behold, as the eyes of servants look towards their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden look towards her mistress; so also our eyes look towards the LORD our God, until he shall have mercy upon us.
123.3: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us; for we have heard a great deal of contempt.
123.4: Our soul has enough of the scorn of mockers, and enough of the contempt of the proud.

124.1: IF it had not been the LORD who stood on our side, now may Israel say,
124.2: If it had not been the LORD who stood on our side when men rose up against us,
124.3: Then would they have swallowed us alive when their wrath was kindled against us,
124.4: Then would they have drowned us in the waters, the stream would have gone over us;
124.5: Then the great waters would have gone over us.
124.6: Blessed be the LORD, who has not given us as a prey to their teeth.
124.7: Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare is broken, and we are delivered.
124.8: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

125.1: THEY who trust in the LORD in the mount of Zion shall not be moved, but shall dwell there for ever.
125.2: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.
125.3: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the portion of the righteous; neither shall the righteous put forth their hands to iniquity.
125.4: Do good, O LORD, to those who are good, and to them who are upright in their hearts.
125.5: But as for those who follow their crooked ways, the LORD will scatter them together with the workers of iniquity; but peace will be upon Israel.

126.1: WHEN the LORD brought back the people of Zion from captivity, we were like those that rejoice.
126.2: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing; then said they among the heathen, The LORD has done great things for them.
126.3: The LORD has done great things for us, whereof we are joyful.
126.4: Turn again our captivity, O LORD, like the streams in the south.
126.5: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
126.6: He who goes forth and weeps, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

127.1: EXCEPT the LORD build the house, they labor in vain who build it; except the LORD keep the city, the watchmen stay awake in vain.
127.2: It is in vain for those who rise up early, who sit up late; they eat the bread of sorrows, for so he gives in sleep to his beloved.
127.3: Lo, children are a heritage of the LORD; and the fruit of the womb is a reward.
127.4: Like arrows in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.
127.5: Blessed is the man who has his quiver full of them; he shall not be ashamed, but shall speak with enemies in the gate.

128.1: BLESSED is every one who fears the LORD, that walks in his ways.
128.2: For you shall eat the labour of your hands; happy shall you be, and it shall be well with you.
128.3: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of your house; your children like olive plants round about your table.
128.4: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed who fears the LORD.
128.5: The LORD will bless you out of Zion; and you shall see the good of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
128.6: Yea, you shall see your children's children, and peace upon Israel.

129.1: MY oppressors have been many from my youth, may Israel now say;
129.2: My oppressors have been many from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.
129.3: They have scourged me upon my back; they have made long their oppression.
129.4: The LORD is righteous; he will cut asunder the cord of the wicked.
129.5: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
129.6: Let them be as the grass upon the house tops, which pulls out and withers when the wind strikes it,
129.7: Wherewith the reaper fills not his hand, nor he who binds sheaves his bosom.
129.8: Neither do they who pass by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you; we bless you in the name of the LORD.

130.1: BUT of the depths have I cried to thee, O LORD, and thou hast heard my voice.
130.2: Let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
130.3: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O LORD, who shall stand?
130.4: Because forgiveness comes from thee, thou mayest be revered.
130.5: I trust in the LORD, my soul waits for his word.
130.6: I have waited for the LORD from the morning watch even until the night watch.
130.7: Let Israel hope in the LORD; from him comes mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
130.8: He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

131.1: LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither do I deal in great matters, nor in things too high for me.
131.2: Surely I have humbled and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of its mother; my soul is even as a weaned child.
131.3: Let Israel hope in the LORD from henceforth and for ever.

132.1: LORD, remember David, and all his afflictions:
132.2: How he swore to the LORD, and vowed to the mighty God of Jacob;
132.3: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
132.4: Nor will I give sleep to mine eyes or slumber to mine eyelids
132.5: Until I find a place for the LORD, a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
132.6: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah; we found it in the fields.
132.7: We will go into his tabernacles; we will worship at his footstool.
132.8: Arise. O LORD, enter into the place of thy rest, thou, and the ark of thy strength.
132.9: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness, and thy saints with glory.
132.10: For thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
132.11: The LORD has sworn in truth to David (he will not turn from it): Of the fruit of your body will I set up your throne.
132.12: If your children will keep my covenant and my testimony that shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon your throne for evermore.
132.13: For the LORD has been delighted with Zion; he has chosen it for his habitation.
132.14: This is my rest for ever; here will I dwell, for I have desired it.
132.15: I will abundantly bless her hunters; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
132.16: I will also clothe her priests with salvation and her saints with glory.
132.17: There shall I make the horn of David to shine, and light a lamp for his anointed?
132.18: His enemies will I clothe with shame; but my holiness shall cover him.

133.1: BEHOLD, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
133.2: It is like the precious ointment upon the head and upon the beard, even Aaron's beard, that went down to the collar of his robe;
133.3: Like the dew of Hermon that falls upon the mount of Zion; for there the LORD commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.

134.1: BEHOLD, bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, who by night stand in the house of the LORD.
134.2: Lift up your hands towards the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.
134.3: The LORD bless you out of Zion, even he who made heaven and earth.

135.1: PRAISE the LORD. Praise the name of the LORD; praise him, O servants of the LORD.
135.2: You who stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,
135.3: Praise the LORD; for the LORD is good; sing praises to his name, for he is delightful.
135.4: For the LORD has chosen Jacob to himself, and Israel for his congregation.
135.5: For I know that the LORD is great, and that our LORD is above all gods.
135.6: Whatsoever the LORD pleases, that he does in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deep places.
135.7: He causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth; he makes lightnings for the rain; he brings the wind out of his treasuries.
135.8: He smote the first-born of Egypt, both of man and beast,
135.9: Who sent forth his signs and wonders into the midst of you, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh and upon all his servants,
135.10: Who smote many nations and slew mighty kings;
135.11: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan;
135.12: And gave their land for a heritage, a heritage to Israel his people.
135.13: Thy name, O LORD, endures for ever; and thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.
135.14: For the LORD will judge his people, and he will delight in his servants.
135.15: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
135.16: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;
135.17: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
135.18: Let them that make them become like them, and every one who trusts in them.
135.19: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel; bless the LORD, O house of Aaron;
135.20: Bless the LORD, O house of Levi; you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
135.21: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, who dwells at Jerusalem. Praise the LORD,

136.1: O GIVE thanks to the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.2: O give thanks to the God of gods; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.3: O give thanks to the LORD of lords; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.4: To him who alone does great wonders; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.5: To him who by wisdom made the heavens; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.6: To him who stretched out the earth above the waters; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.7: To him who made great lights; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.8: The sun to rule by day; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.9: The moon and stars to rule by night; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.10: To him who smote the first-born of Egypt; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.11: And brought out Israel from among them; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.12: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.13: To him who divided the Red sea into parts; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.14: And Israel to pass through the midst of it; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.15: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.16: To him who led his people through the wilderness; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.17: To him who smote great kings; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.18: And slew mighty kings; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.19: Sihon king of the Amorites; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.20: And Og the king of Bashan; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.21: And gave their land for a heritage; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.22: Even a heritage to Israel his servant; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.23: Who remembered us during our affliction; for his mercy endures for ever;
136.24: And has saved us from our enemies; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.25: Who gives food to all flesh; for his mercy endures for ever.
136.26: O give thanks to the God who is in heaven; for his mercy endures for ever.

137.1: BY the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down. yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
137.2: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
137.3: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and our captors said to us, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
137.4: How shall we sing the LORD'S song in a strange land?
137.5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget me.
137.6: If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to my palate, if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
137.7: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem, who said, Raze it, raze it, even to the foundation thereof.
137.8: O daughter of Babylon, taker of spoils, blessed shall he be who rewards you as you have served us.
137.9: Blessed shall he be who takes and dashes your little ones against the stones.

138.1: I WILL praise thee with my whole heart; before the kings will I sing praise to thee.
138.2: I will worship in thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth; for thou hast magnified thy word above every name.
138.3: In the day when I cried to thee, thou didst answer me, and didst increase the strength of my soul.
138.4: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, for they have heard the words of thy mouth.
138.5: Yea, they shall praise the ways of the LORD; for great is the glory of the LORD.
138.6: Though the LORD be high, yet can he see those who have been brought low; but the proud he knows from afar.
138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt save me; thou shalt stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
138.8: O LORD, rest thy right hand upon me; thy mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; forsake not the works of thine own hands.

139.1: O LORD, thou hast searched me and known me.
139.2: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thoughts from above.
139.3: Thou knowest my way and my paths, and art acquainted with all my ways.
139.4: For if there is deception in my tongue, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
139.5: From the beginning to the end, thou knowest me, O LORD, for thou hast formed and laid thy hand upon me.
139.6: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
139.7: Whither shall I go from thy Spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
139.8: If I ascend into heaven, thou art there; if I descend into Sheol, behold, thou art there also.
139.9: If I lift up my wings like those of an eagle, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
139.10: Even there also shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
139.11: If I say, Surely the darkness shall be as light upon me; even the night shall be light before my face.
139.12: The darkness shall not be dark to thee; but the night shines as the day; the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
139.13: For thou hast made my heart; thou hast accepted me from my mother's womb.
139.14: I will praise thee, because of the wonders which thou hast done; marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knows right well.
139.15: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and marvellously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
139.16: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being imperfect; and upon thy books all these things were written, even before day was and man was brought into existence.
139.17: How precious also are thy mercies to me, O God! How great is the sum of them?
139.18: If I should count the best of them, they are more in number than the grains of sand; when I awake I am still with thee.
139.19: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God; depart from me therefore, you bloody men.
139.20: For they speak against thee, and have taken thy city without cause.
139.21: I hate them, O LORD, who hate thee; and I am grieved with those who rise up against thee.
139.22: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them mine enemies.
139.23: Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me, and know my ways,
139.24: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

140.1: DELIVER me, O LORD, from the evil man; preserve me from violent men,
140.2: Who devise mischiefs in their heart; continually do they stir up contention.
140.3: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips.
140.4: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from violent men, who have purposed to prevent my goings.
140.5: The proud have hid a snare for me; the cords of their net have they spread over my paths; they have set a trap for me.
140.6: I said to the LORD, Thou art my God; hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.
140.7: O LORD, my mighty Saviour, thou art the shield of my head in the day of battle.
140.8: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; further not their wicked devices; let them not accomplish their purpose.
140.9: Let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
140.10: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them fall into the fire, that they rise not up again.
140.11: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth; evil shall hunt the violent man to destroy him.
140.12: I know that the LORD will defend the cause of the afflicted and the right of the poor.
140.13: Surely the righteous shall give thanks to thy name; the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

141.1: LORD, I cry to thee; make haste to answer me; give ear to my words and accept them.
141.2: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense, and the gift of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
141.3: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips,
141.4: So that my heart may not incline to evil things, and practise wicked works with men who work iniquity; let me not eat salt with them.
141.5: Let the righteous teach me and reprove me; let the oil of the wicked not anoint my head since my prayer has been against their evils.
141.6: When their judges are stopped by a strong hand, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
141.7: Like the ploughshare that scatters the earth, let their bones be scattered at the mouth of the grave.
141.8: I have lifted up mine eyes to thee, O LORD; I have trusted in thee; do not reject my soul.
141.9: Keep me from the hand of the proud, for they have set traps for me.
141.10: Let the wicked together fall into their own nets, whilst I shall pass over.

142.1: I CRIED to the LORD with voice; my with my voice to the LORD did I make my supplication.
142.2: I poured out my complaint before him; I showed before him my trouble.
142.3: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they secretly laid a snare for me.
142.4: I looked on my right hand, and there was no one to advise me; refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
142.5: I cried to thee, O LORD; I said, Thou art my hope and my portion, O LORD, in the land of the living.
142.6: Attend to my cry; for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.
142.7: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name; thy righteous shall wait for me until thou shalt reward me.

143.1: HEAR my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications; in thine own words answer me, and in thy righteousness.
143.2: And do not let thy servant be brought to judgment; for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
143.3: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground; he has made me to dwell in darkness, like those who have been long dead.
143.4: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is troubled.
143.5: I remember thee, O LORD, from days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.
143.6: I stretch forth my hands to thee; my soul thirsts after thee, as a thirsty land.
143.7: Answer me speedily, O LORD; my spirit fails; hide not thy face from me, lest I be like them who go down into the pit.
143.8: Cause me to hear of thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust; cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, for I lift up my soul to thee.
143.9: Deliver me, O LORD, from mine enemies, and teach me to do thy will.
143.10: Because thou art my God, thy gentle spirit shall lead me into the way of life.
143.11: Comfort me, O LORD, for thy name's sake; for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12: And by thy mercy silence those who hate me, and destroy all the enemies of my soul; for I am thy servant.

144.1: BLESSED be the LORD, my strength, who teaches my hands to war and my fingers to fight;
144.2: My refuge and my deliverer; my shield and my helper, upon whom I trust, who subdues nations under me.
144.3: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him? or the son of man, that thou art mindful of him?
144.4: Man is like vapour; his days are as a shadow that passes away.
144.5: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down; rebuke the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144.6: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them; shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.
144.7: Stretch forth thy hand from above; deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of the ungodly,
144.8: Whose mouths speak vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9: I will sing a new song to thee, O God; upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises to thee.
144.10: It is he who gives salvation to kings; who delivers David his servant from the hurtful sword.
144.11: Deliver me from the hand of the wicked, whose mouths speak vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood,
144.12: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as brides richly adorned after the fashion of temples;
144.13: That our storehouses may be full to overflowing; that our sheep may multiply abundantly in our streets;
144.14: That our cattle may be strong and there be none barren among them; that there be no stealing, and that there be no mourning in our streets.
144.15: Happy is the people who have all these things; yea, happy is the people, whose God is the LORD.

145.1: I WILL extol thee, O my LORD, the King; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
145.2: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
145.3: Great is our LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.
145.4: One generation shall tell thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.
145.5: I will speak of the glorious honor of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.
145.6: And men shall speak of the might of thy wonderful acts; and I will declare thy greatness.
145.7: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, thy righteous shall seek and shall find it.
145.8: The LORD is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and of great mercy.
145.9: The LORD is good to all, and his tender mercies are over all his servants.
145.10: All thy servants shall give thee thanks, O LORD, and thy saints shall praise thee.
145.11: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power,
145.12: To make known to the sons of men thy might and the glorious majesty of thy kingdom.
145.13: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endures throughout all generations. The LORD is faithful in his words and righteous in all his works.
145.14: The LORD upholds all who fall, and raises up all who are bowed down.
145.15: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their food in due season.
145.16: Thou openest thy hand and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
145.17: The LORD is righteous in all his ways and merciful in all his works.
145.18: The LORD is near to all who call upon him, to all who call upon him in truth.
145.19: He will fulfil the desire of those who worship him; he also will hear their cry and will save them.
145.20: The LORD preserves all who love him; but all the wicked he will destroy.
145.21: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD; let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

146.1: PRAISE the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
146.2: While I live will I praise the LORD; I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.
146.3: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
146.4: His breath goes forth, he returns to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.
146.5: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God,
146.6: Who made heaven and earth, the sea and all that therein is; who keeps truth for ever;
146.7: Who executes justice for the oppressed; who gives food to the hungry. The LORD releases the prisoners;
146.8: The LORD opens the eyes of the blind; the LORD raises those who are bowed down; the LORD loves the righteous;
146.9: The LORD takes care of the poor; he feeds the fatherless and widows; but the way of the wicked he turns upside down.
146.10: The LORD shall reign for ever, even your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise the LORD.

147.1: PRAISE the LORD; for it is good to sing praises to our God; for it is pleasant, and praise is comely.
147.2: The LORD builds up Jerusalem; he gathers together the scattered of Israel.
147.3: He heals the broken of heart, and binds up their wounds.
147.4: He counts the number of the stars; he calls them all by their names.
147.5: Great is our LORD, and great is his power; his understanding is infinite.
147.6: The LORD lifts up the meek; he humbles the wicked down to the ground.
147.7: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp to our God,
147.8: Who covers the heavens with clouds, who gives rain upon the earth, who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
147.9: He gives to the cattle their food, and to the young ravens which cry.
147.10: He delights not in the strength of the horse; he takes no pleasure in the legs of a mighty man.
147.11: The LORD takes pleasure in those who revere him, in those who hope in his mercy.
147.12: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion.
147.13: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates; he has blessed your children within you.
147.14: He makes peace in your borders, and fills you with the finest of the wheat.
147.15: He sends forth his commandment upon earth; his word runs very swiftly.
147.16: He gives snow like wool; he scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.
147.17: He casts forth his ice like morsels; who can stand before his cold?
147.18: He sends out his word and melts them; he causes his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
147.19: He declares his word to Jacob, his statutes and his judgments to Israel.
147.20: He has not dealt so with all nations; and his judgments he has not made known to them. Praise the LORD.

148.1: PRAISE the LORD. Praise the LORD from the heavens; praise him in the heights.
148.2: Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his hosts.
148.3: Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all stars and light.
148.4: Praise him, heavens of heavens, and waters that are above the heavens.
148.5: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for he spoke and they were made, he commanded and they were created.
148.6: He has also established them for ever and ever; he has made a decree which shall not pass.
148.7: Praise the LORD from the earth, you great serpents and all deeps;
148.8: Fire and hail, snow and ice, stormy wind fulfilling his word,
148.9: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars,
148.10: Wild beasts and all cattle, creeping things and flying fowl,
148.11: Kings of the earth and all people, princes and all judges of the earth,
148.12: Both boys and maidens, old men and young men, let them praise the name of the LORD;
148.13: For his name alone is excellent; his glory is on earth and in heaven.
148.14: He also exalts the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near to him. Praise the LORD.

149.1: PRAISE the LORD. Sing to the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.
149.2: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him; let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
149.3: Let them praise his name with the timbrel and psaltery; let them sing praises to him with the harps.
149.4: For the LORD takes pleasure in his people; he has given salvation to the poor.
149.5: Let the righteous become mighty in glory; let them glorify him upon their beds.
149.6: Let them exalt God with their throats, and with a two-edged sword in their hand,
149.7: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the peoples,
149.8: To bind their kings with fetters and their nobles with chains of iron.
149.9: To execute upon them the judgment that is written; and give glory to all his saints. Praise the LORD.

150.1: PRAISE the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in the firmament of his power.
150.2: Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him according to his excellent greatness.
150.3: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet; praise him with the psaltery and harp.
150.4: Praise him with timbrel and pipe; praise him with sweet stringed instruments.
150.5: Praise him upon loud cymbals; praise him with a mighty song.
150.6: Let every thing that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.

1.1: THE proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
1.2: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
1.3: To receive discipline, reverence, righteousness, and justice, and equity;
1.4: To give subtlety to the simple, to the young men knowledge and discretion.
1.5: A wise man will listen and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain to leadership;
1.6: To understand proverbs and figures of speech; the words of the wise and their dark sayings.
1.7: The reverence of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; but fools despise knowledge and instruction.
1.8: Hear, my son, the ordinance of your father, and forsake not the law of your mother;
1.9: For they shall be an ornament of grace for your head and a necklace about your neck.
1.10: My son, if sinners entice you, consent not.
1.11: If they say to you, Come with us, let us lie in wait to shed blood, let us lie in wait for the innocent, wrongfully;
1.12: Let us swallow them up alive, as Sheol swallows the living, and whole as those who go down into the pit;
1.13: We shall find all his wealth and precious things, we shall fill our houses with spoil;
1.14: Cast in your lot with us; let us all have one purse;
1.15: My son, do not walk in the way with them; but refrain your foot from their path;
1.16: For their feet run to evil, they make haste to shed blood.
1.17: Surely in deceit is the net spread in the sight of any bird.
1.18: And they lie in wait, they hide themselves to shed blood.
1.19: Such are the ways of all who practice iniquity, who take away the life of their owners.
1.20: Wisdom is glorified in the market places; she raises her voice in the streets:
1.21: She preaches in the chief places of the concourse; in the openings of the gates of the city, she utters her words, saying,
1.22: How long, you simple ones, will you love childishness? And the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
1.23: If you will turn to my reproof, behold, I will pour out my spirit upon you; I will make known my words to you.
1.24: For I have called, and you refused; I have stretched out my hand, and you did not listen:
1.25: But you have despised all my counsels, and you were not pleased with my reproof.
1.26: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will rejoice when terror and sudden destruction come upon you;
1.27: When your destruction comes as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come upon you,
1.28: Then they shall call upon me, but I will not answer them; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me;
1.29: Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the worship of the LORD.
1.30: They were not pleased with my counsels; they rejected all of my reproof.
1.31: Therefore they shall eat of the fruit of their own ways and be filled with their own devices.
1.32: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the error of the weak-minded men shall destroy them.
1.33: But he who listens to me shall live in hope, and shall refrain from many evils.

2.1: MY son, if you will receive my words and hide my commandments in your heart,
2.2: And incline your ear to wisdom and apply your heart to understanding,
2.3: Yea, if you cry after knowledge and lift up your voice to understanding,
2.4: If you seek it as silver, and search for it as for hidden treasure;
2.5: Then you will understand how to worship the LORD and find the knowledge of God.
2.6: For it is the LORD who gives wisdom; out of his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
2.7: He stores up hope for the upright; he helps those who walk without blemish.
2.8: He keeps the paths of justice, and preserves the ways of his saints.
2.9: Then you will understand righteousness and justice and the uprightness of all good ways.
2.10: When wisdom enters into your heart and knowledge is pleasant to your soul.
2.11: Intelligence shall preserve you, and the understanding of the pious men shall deliver you;
2.12: That you might be delivered from evil ways, from men who speak perverse things,
2.13: Who forsake the path of uprightness to walk in the way of darkness;
2.14: Who rejoice to do evil and delight in the perverseness of evil things;
2.15: Men whose ways are crooked and whose paths are perverse.
2.16: Wisdom shall deliver you from a strange woman who flatters with her words,
2.17: Who has forsaken the mother of her youth and forgotten the covenant of her God.
2.18: For she has forgotten the threshold of her house and the way of her paths.
2.19: None who go to her return again, neither do they remember the path of life.
2.20: Therefore you must walk in the way of good men and keep the path of the righteous.
2.21: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and those who are unblemished shall remain in it.
2.22: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth and the ungodly shall be rooted out of it.

3.1: My son, do not forget my law; but let your heart keep my commandments;
3.2: For the length of days and long life will they add to you;
3.3: And peace, mercy, and truth will not forsake you; bind them about your neck; write them upon the tablets of your heart:
3.4: So you shall find favor, grace, and understanding in the sight of God and men.
3.5: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and rely not on your own wisdom.
3.6: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct your paths.
3.7: Be not wise in your own eyes; revere the LORD, and depart from evil.
3.8: It shall be healing to your flesh and marrow to your bones.
3.9: Honor the LORD with your substance and with the first fruits of all your crops;
3.10: So shall your barns be filled with plenty, and your wine presses shall burst out with new wine.
3.11: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD, neither be weary of his corrections.
3.12: For whom the LORD loves he corrects, even as a father corrects his son.
3.13: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, and the son of the man who finds understanding.
3.14: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and its gains than fine gold.
3.15: She is more valuable than precious stones; and there is nothing to be compared to her.
3.16: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honor.
3.17: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
3.18: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her; and blessed are those who wait for her.
3.19: The LORD by his wisdom has founded the earth; by his understanding he established the heavens.
3.20: By his knowledge the depths are broken up and the clouds drop down the dew.
3.21: My son, let not my commandments depart from your eyes; keep my doctrine, and my counsels;
3.22: So shall they be life to your soul and grace to your neck.
3.23: Then you shall walk in your way with hope and your foot shall not stumble.
3.24: When you lie down, you shall not be afraid; yea, you shall lie down and your sleep shall be sweet.
3.25: You shall not fear sudden tumult, neither the violence of the wicked, when it comes.
3.26: For the LORD shall be with you and shall keep your foot that you may not be caught in the snare.
3.27: Do not refuse to do that which is good, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
3.28: When you have something, do not say to your neighbor, Go, and come again tomorrow, and I will give it to you.
3.29: Do not devise evil against your neighbor, seeing he dwells in peace beside you.
3.30: Do not contend with a man without a cause, if he has done you no harm.
3.31: Do not envy a wicked man, and choose none of his ways.
3.32: For the wicked man is an abomination in the presence of the LORD: but the secret of the LORD is with the upright.
3.33: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked; but he blesses the habitation of the righteous.
3.34: Surely he despises scorners; but he has compassion on the wise.
3.35: Wise men shall inherit glory; but fools shall receive disgrace.

4.1: HEAR, O my children, the instruction of a father, and give ear to knowledge and understanding.
4.2: Because I give you good doctrine, do not forsake my law.
4.3: For I was also a son to my father, tender and the only begotten in the sight of my mother.
4.4: He taught me, and said to me, Let your heart hold fast my words; keep my commandments, and live; and let my law be as the pupil of the eye.
4.5: Get wisdom, get understanding; and turn not aside from the words of my mouth.
4.6: Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you; love her, and she will save you.
4.7: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom; and with all your substance get understanding.
4.8: Love her, and she shall exalt you; embrace her, and she shall honor you.
4.9: She shall put upon your head an ornament of grace; a crown of glory shall she bestow upon you.
4.10: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of your life shall be many.
4.11: I have taught you the ways of wisdom; I have led you in right paths.
4.12: When you walk, your steps will not be unsteady; and when you run, you will not stumble.
4.13: Take fast hold of my instruction, and do not forsake her; keep her, for she is your life.
4.14: Do not walk in the way of evil men, and do not envy the way of the wicked.
4.15: The place where they dwell, do not pass by it, turn away from it,
4.16: For they do not sleep until they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away until their evil devices are carried out.
4.17: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
4.18: But the path of the righteous is like the shining light that shines more and more unto the perfect day.
4.19: The way of the wicked is like darkness; they do not know at what they stumble.
4.20: My son, attend to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.
4.21: Do not let them depart from your eyes; but keep them in the midst of your heart.
4.22: For they are life to him who finds them, and health to all his flesh.
4.23: Keep your heart with all diligence, for out of it are the issues of life.
4.24: Put away from you a perverse mouth, and the counsel of deceit put far from your lips.
4.25: Let your eyes look straight forward, and let your eyelids look straight before you.
4.26: Keep your feet away from evil paths; then all your ways shall be firm.
4.27: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; but remove your foot from evil.

5.1: MY son, attend to my wisdom and incline your ear to my understanding,
5.2: That you may heed counsel and that your lips may keep knowledge.
5.3: For the lips of a strange woman drop as a honeycomb, and her words are smoother than oil;
5.4: But the end of her life is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
5.5: Her feet cause men to go down to death; her steps take her to Sheol.
5.6: She does not tread upon the land of the living, her paths are devious, and are unknown.
5.7: Hear me now therefore, O you children, and do not depart from the words of my mouth.
5.8: Remove your way far from her, and do not come near the door of her house;
5.9: Lest you give your strength to others, and your years to the cruel;
5.10: Lest strangers be filled with your wealth, and your labors be in the house of strangers;
5.11: And you have remorse in your old age, when the flesh of your body is consumed,
5.12: And you say, Why did I hate instruction, and my heart despise reproof,
5.13: And why have I not obeyed the voice of my teacher, nor inclined my ear to them that instructed me?
5.14: I was in almost all kinds of evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
5.15: Drink water out of your own well, and running water from your own spring.
5.16: Let your water overflow into your streets, let it be disbursed abroad.
5.17: Let it be for yourself alone, let not strangers be partners with you.
5.18: Let your fountain be blessed: and rejoice in the wife of your youth.
5.19: Let her be like a loving hind, and pleasant mountain roe; learn her ways always, and be mindful of her love.
5.20: My son, be not misled by a strange woman, neither embrace the bosom of a strange woman.
5.21: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and all his paths lie open in his presence.
5.22: The wicked shall be caught by his own iniquities, and he will be bound with the cords of his sins.
5.23: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

6.1: MY son, if you have become surety for your friend, if you have obligated yourself to a stranger,
6.2: Then you are snared with the words of your mouth, you are caught with the words of your lips.
6.3: Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself because, for the sake of your friend, you have fallen into the hands of your enemies; go, therefore, and stir up your friend for whom you have become surety to meet his obligation.
6.4: You shall not give sleep to your eyes nor slumber to your eyelids.
6.5: Deliver yourself like a gazelle from the snare, and like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
6.6: Be like the ant, consider her ways, and be wise;
6.7: Though having no harvest and no ruler over her, neither any one to guide her,
6.8: She provides her bread in the summer and gathers her food in the harvest.
6.9: How long will you sleep, O sluggard? When will you arise from your sleep?
6.10: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands on the chest;
6.11: And then poverty shall come upon you, and distress shall overtake you; become a successful man.
6.12: A fool, a wicked man, is unscrupulous.
6.13: He winks with his eyes, he signals with his feet, he makes signs with his fingers;
6.14: He is perverse in his heart, he devises mischief continually; he sows discord.
6.15: Therefore his calamity shall come suddenly; suddenly will he be broken without remedy.
6.16: There are six things which the LORD hates; yea, the seventh is an abomination to him:
6.17: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood.
6.18: A heart that devises wicked imaginations, feet that are swift in running to mischief,
6.19: A false witness who speaks lies, and he who sows discord among brothers.
6.20: My son, keep your father's commandment and do not forsake the law of your mother;
6.21: Impress them firmly on your heart and tie them about your neck.
6.22: When you walk, let them follow you; let them be with you, keep them that they may keep you; and when you awake, meditate on them.
6.23: For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is a light, and the reproofs of instruction are the way of life,
